The game balances administration of existing laws with commercial exploitation of the areas resources and the preservation of the region's unique ecosystem. This occurs against the backdrop of the invasive spread of pine trees. The game is played in turns representing one year of game time. A computer program is used to combine player input with ecological models to predict outcomes.

197597.name: Njoobari
197597.description:
User summary:

Players in the game assume the role of farmers in the Senegal River Valley. Characters seek economic exploitation of the area through a variety of farming techniques, some of which are sustainable and others of which are not. The game seeks to balance maximum economic exploitation with long-term sustainability. A computer system is used to match character decisions with ecological models to predict outcomes.

197598.name: Maybe Clones Aren't Such A Good Thing!!
197598.description:
A Paranoia Adventure designed for 1st edition Paranoia that will easily run in any version.
This module was written for the North Texas RPG Con 2013. It was created for 6-10 players of Orange or Yellow security clearance. Pre-generated characters are included. Based on the original block buster movie and book - Jurassic Park, let your troubleshooters loose as they investigate the outbreak of Feral Attack Chickens, navigate a manually operated submersable vehicle and come face to face with the horrors protecting the small island run by none other than traitorous mutant Hamm-O-NND-6.

197599.name: Elevated State
197599.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are cyborgs with a "glitched" system for suppressing emotions. Throughout the game, random emotions pop up and the characters must respond do them. Characters are created with narrative descriptions only and it is assumed most characterization will occur during play. The game is played in four structured turns, or phases.

197600.name: Hollow Realm
197600.description:
From the introduction:

There are three realms of existence. The Bitter Realm, ordered,uncluttered, constant, and crystalline. The Realm of Filth, hungry, dynamic, ugly, and incomprehensible. In between these realms lies our world, the Hollow Realm. It alone is malleable and yet ordered. The Realm of Filth and the Bitter Realm are at war. We are the weapons they use. Our deaths are the tally they keep. All sickness, all death, all evil, is external to man, inflicted upon us by the forces of the Worm and the Snowflake. They hide their war from the world, bury it in mundanity. The few that have stumbled upon the war quickly regret it.

197601.name: To Live, You Must Die
197601.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have two Attributes - Material and Immaterial. The character selects one to be "odd" and one to be "even". Characters identify an "expertise" (Skill) for each Attribute. Actions are resolved with a dice pool, with the roll being tallied as either odd or event. The game also uses a Flux Pool, which allows dice substitution (e.g., narrative control).

197602.name: One Summer Night
197602.description:
User summary:

The game is for exactly two players. Characters in the game are defined as a young girl and a space worm. They have only narrative traits. Game resolution is entirely narrative and focuses around one or more discussions that occur between the girl and the worm.

197603.name: Uncertain Paths
197603.description:
User summary:

The game is for exactly four players. The game uses a small set of custom cards which are not included but would be trivial to construct. Player characters have traits with numeric values that fluctuate during play. Characters assume differing roles during the game depending upon which card they hold.

The document provides a few sample "story seed" entries as suggested scenarios.

197604.name: Trauma Control
197604.description:
From the introduction:

Trauma Control is a game about being pushed past your breaking point and attempting to pull the pieces together. Something horrible has happened to the protagonist, and together players will tell a story that reassembles the character's history. As they explore the physical environment – an asylum, a mansion, a suburban home – they will put together experiences and sensations to reunite (or finally destroy) the protagonist’s fragmented self.

User summary:

The game requires a custom card deck of 100 cards. The cards are not provided in the document but it provides a brief suggestion of what they may be like. The cards are used to present an image to spur creativity. Otherwise, the game entirely is a narrative excursion.

197605.name: Syth
197605.description:
From the introduction:

Underneath the sewers of Unification City thrives a hidden civilization of lycanthropes. With hundreds of mouths to feed, the werewolf king Jax sends out numerous scouts to the surface world to retrieve food. Syth is the leader of the lycanthrope scouts, and the best one they have.

197606.name: Excendance
197606.description:
User summary:

This rules-light story-telling game uses simple token draws to determine outcomes, though narrative resolution is preferred. Two colors of tokens are used, one representing Unity and the other representing Defiance. Most of the game setting and scenario is created during play. Players take turns being the "Narrator" of events.

197607.name: Fate of Humanity
197607.description:
From the introduction:

In this game players take on the roles of the various factions trying to steer the course of human achievement. Each faction has an ultimate goal it wants to see humanity achieve, and each faction is directly opposed by another. Through a little cooperation and maybe more than a bit of backstabbing each player will try to drive humanity towards embracing their particular agenda.

User summary:

This game uses many elements of standard board games merged with narrative elements of standard role-playing to present a fairly unusual "storytelling" system. The game document includes some (poorly-formatted) print-and-play components.

197608.name: Icon Theatre Proudly Presents...
197608.description:
User summary:

This free-form storytelling game uses the simple expedient of rock-paper-scissors to determine the outcomes of narrative impasse. Otherwise, characters are (very unique) radio hosts who create a thrilling radio broadcast for their listeners. The game is entirely narrative in nature. The document presents the various idiosyncratic characters and several introductory "plot hooks"; players must then have their characters elaborate.

197609.name: Jacob's Ladder
197609.description:
From the introduction:

Life on Earth has become hell. Mega corporations and zaibatsus rule with tyrannical hands. The environment has taken a blunt blow when development and exploitation has been the keywords by leading power figures. But in 2075 a new hope rose for mankind when it began its greatest project, the Space Elevator. To many it became known as Jacob’s Ladder, after the Biblical myth of a ladder to the heavens. Some said it would become the fall of man while others spoke of it as the salvation. It took over 50 years of sacrifices and financial hardship to complete the space elevator. It also became the last project of Earth’s collected world societies before the collapse.

197610.name: Road to Ruin
197610.description:
User summary:

Road to Ruin features a traditional fantasy setting, with characters spending their time looting and fighting. The game uses a hex-based map and focuses heavily on tactical combat. A variety of special icons and cards are used during play. These are provided as color print-and-play components in separate downloads.

The game typically is distributed as a ZIP archive containing these documents:


Read Me (TXT file with art credits)
Road to Ruin (DOC file with main rules
Arena (DOC file with print-and-play map)
Icons (DOC file with print-and-play icons)
Tiles (DOC file with print-and-play tiles)

197611.name: La Péri
197611.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Inspired by Walt Disney's Fantasia, La Péri is a visually stunning pas de deux between two dancers, one played by you! On the stage, you are Iskender, a dying prince, in search of the flower of immortality. Finally, when reaching the coveted artifact, you face a guardian spirit, La Péri, who gradually turns into a beautiful ballerina that bewitches you to prevent you from taking possession of the flower.

This new VR experience made for roomscale VR is focused on a dancer's performance. Immersed in a piece of classical music, the viewer will be surrounded by a whirlwind of movement, color and form in perfect synesthesia. Theater, dance, photography and cinema have always imposed a frame for the stage or the screen. VR, on the other hand, is the first visual art to be fundamentally free of these constraints, offering a virtual space that the viewer can truly embody.

Source: The Developer Website.

197612.name: Automata Empire
197612.description:
Seize power as the ruler of an empire of fuzzy cellular automata monsters!

Inspired by Conway's Game of Life, Automata Empire challenges you to herd hundreds of mindless automata to smash your rivals’ castles and steal their territory. While your loyal subjects lack individual intelligence, you can sacrifice them to build chains of taverns and roads to impose order on chaos. Ready to invade? Build some high-velocity catapults to launch your minions directly into battle. Balance expansion and consolidation carefully to grow your empire into enemy territory and gain dominance over the toroid. Or cleverly engineer feedback loops to surprise your opponents with overwhelming force.

Source: The Game Website.

197614.name: Qwirkle Mega Pack
197614.description: Compilation of Qwirkle and Erweiterung 1+2. This includes the base game, Qwirkle Select, Qwirkle Connect and Pick 3!. This Compilation does not include The Qwirkle Erweiterung 2 (2016).

boardgameintegration: Halo: Fleet Battles – The Fall of Reach
Halo: Fleet Battles – The Fall of Reach
197617.description:
From the publisher:

Spartan Games is hugely excited to announce the pre-sale of Halo: Ground Command, the latest game to be set in the Halo universe. Using highly detailed 1/100th scale figures and vehicles, the Battle Force game features powerful, yet easy to master game mechanics and has been created to bring the atmosphere of the Halo video games to wargaming tabletops around the world.

The Battle for Reach 2-player set is an easy way for gamers to start playing large scale ground warfare, and comes with the following components:


Full colour Halo: Ground Command Rulebook



Statistic Sheets (UNSC and Covenant)



Reference Sheet



20x Custom Dice and 6x Halo Command Dice



Game Tokens (Damage, Activation and Cooldown)



Halo Scenery



UNSC 1,000 Point Battle Force – including 1x Officer, 1x Medic, 1x Radio Operator, 2x Snipers, 2x Spotters, 2x 2-man HMG Teams, 2x 2-man Missile Teams, 27x Troopers, 2x Warthogs (Gatling, Gauss and Rocket Weapons for each) and a 1x Spartan.



Covenant 1,000 Point Battle Force – including 1x Elite Ultra, 2x Elite Minor, 3x Elite Majors, 6x Grunts with Fuel Rods, 24x Grunt Minors, 3x Ghosts with Grunt Operator and 2x Hunters.


Halo: Ground Command is designed to as a highly modular game, allowing players to easily customise their forces. The contents of this 2-player box can quickly and intuitively be added to, allowing additional units of Infantry (such as Spartans, ODST, Elites and Jackals), Armour (such as Warthogs, Scorpions, Ghosts and Wraiths) and Aerial (such as Pelican Dropships, Banshees and Phantom Troop Carriers) to be bought.
boardgameversion: Halo: Ground Command Battle for Reach
197617.name: Halo: Ground Command

197619.name: 1979 Revolution: Black Friday
videogamehonor: 2016 IndieCade Grand Jury Award Winner
2016 The Game Awards Best Impact of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Game Direction of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Sprite Award Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Honorable Mention
2017 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Honorable Mention
2017 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Nominee
2017 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Honorable Mention
2017 SXSW Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
197619.description:
The year is 1978, the place is Tehran, Iran. You are Reza Shirazi, a striving photojournalist, who after studying abroad returns home to find his people in a bloodied uprising against the ruling King, the Shah. Led by your best friend, Babak, you are swept up by a web of underground activities and meet a vivid cast of characters. As the revolution tears through your country, friends and family, the fates of those around you hinge on the consequences of your choices.

Source: The Game Website.

197620.name: Blob the Cop
197620.description:
User Summary

A platform shooter which was only available as a Sinclair User magazine cover tape. You play as Blob and proceed around the levels shooting enemies.

197621.name: Premier League
197621.description:
User Summary

An early football management game for the ZX Spectrum and Commodore 64.

Developed by Alan J. Clayton.

197622.name: Monopoly: Halo Collector's Edition
197622.description: Join Master Chief on a campaign to gain control of critical locations and legendary assets from the Halo Universe in the special collector’s edition of Halo MONOPOLY. Use your wits to take command of Arcadia, the Covenant capital of High Charity, or even Earth itself.

197623.name: Behind Closed Doors
197623.description:
User Summary

A text adventure parody of The Lord of the Rings. You play as the Balrog who finds himself locked in the toilet and had to find a way to get out.

197625.name: A Wizard's Lizard: Soul Thief
197625.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




A hardcore rogue-lite action RPG where you possess and play as monsters. Narrowly avoid death as you explore challenging, ever-changing dungeons, and possess any body you can to survive!

Source: The Game Website.

197626.name: Enter the Gungeon
197626.description:
Enter the Gungeon is a bullet hell dungeon crawler following a band of misfits seeking to shoot, loot, dodge roll and table-flip their way to personal absolution by reaching the legendary Gungeon’s ultimate treasure: the gun that can kill the past.

Source: The Developer Website.

197627.name: Until I Have You
197627.description:
If you could save someone, how much of yourself would you be willing to sacrifice? Until I Have You aims to recount a thrilling story of regret, love, corruption, and things gone haywire, under the strong, vibrant neon lights of a metropolitan city that just doesn't give a damn.

Source: The Game Website.

197628.name: Spin-it Bible Trivia
197628.description:
This is a trivia challenge with a Bible theme. It uses question cards and a spinner. Players twirl the device and answer a color-coded inquiry matching the result. Points are scored based on the difficulty level... once again this is determined by the color-coded cards with purple earning 3 points, green 2 points, etc.

The first player to score 10 points is declared the winner. For a slightly longer game a specified time limit can be set. Age range is (perhaps) 10 and older.

Includes the spinner, 21 cards, and a score pad.

197629.name: Vanishing Realms
197629.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Vanishing Realms is an immersive RPG designed exclusively for Virtual Reality. Grab your sword and fight life-sized monsters in epic face-to-face melee combat. Explore mystic domains, outwit magical wards, seek lost artifacts, wield sorcery and steel to take on denizens of the Undead Realm.

Source: The Game Website.

197630.name: Medical Trivia
197630.description:
This is a set of expansion cards published in 1985 by Eli Lilly, a pharmaceutical manufacturer. They are designed to be used with classic Trivial Pursuit.

There are six categories:

Great Names In Medicine
Pharmacology
Specialty Medicine
Diagnosis
Great Discoveries In Medicine
Medical Curiosities

The difficulty level is quite high; these cards were obviously designed for a target audience of medical professionals.

197631.description:
The American Revolution in the South is a single map game that simulates ten historic campaigns in North and South Carolina during the American Revolutionary War (from 1776 to 1781). The game system emphasizes the importance of individual leaders, and especially historical leaders from the time period, and highlights the relative skills, circumstances, and luck that could vary considerably, often within short periods of time. Throughout the game, leader skills will be tested as their unit’s maneuver and fight, and every leader has the capacity to prove himself as either inept, capable, or in some cases, exceptional, during various incidents throughout the game.

S&T #304, March-April 2017
197631.name: The American Revolution in the South

197632.name: Armies of the White Sun
197632.description:
Armies of the White Sun is a solitaire wargame covering the fighting in China from the Marco Polo Bridge Incident through Pearl Harbor to the planned 1943 Operation Go-Go aimed at capturing Chongking and ending Chinese resistance at the national level. The single player actively commands the invading Japanese forces, while the rules system directs him in the deployment of the defending Chinese. The player wins by capturing key areas on the map. Throughout the game, the player selects units for an operational force, then maneuvers with that force to achieve objectives while fighting Chinese forces as they appear during operations.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 280 counters

S&T 305 May-June 2017

197633.description:
Agricola is a wargame of the campaign fought by Gnaeus Julius Agricola, the Roman governor of Britain (AD 77-85) to conquer northern Britannia (modern Britain). There are two players, the Roman and the Caledonian (the latter actually representing various northern British tribes). Each player is provided with cardboard pieces called “units” that represent military formations or tribal warbands. Players move their units, conduct battles and objectives.

Each player has a set of Stratagem markers. Players use these markers to recruit new units, move their forces on the map, and take special actions. Whenever opposing forces are in the same hex, a battle will ensue. Various Stratagem markers can also be used to enhance operations.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 117 counters

S&T #306 Jul-August 2017
197633.name: Agricola

197634.name: Cold War, Hot Armor
197634.description:
Cold War, Hot Armor is a two-player game in which players take command in armored actions during the Cold War. The game is part of a series; this particular game is set during the War in Vietnam, 1954-75. Future games will include battles in continental Africa, the Middle East and eventually a hypothetical NATO-Warsaw Pact conflict. The game system emphasizes command control, combined arms, and evolving technology.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 280 counters

S&T #307, Sept-Oct. 2017

197635.description:
The War of Jenkins’ Ear simulates the last major conflict in the Caribbean between England and Spain from about 1739 to 1748 (though it was largely eclipsed in Europe by the War of Austrian Succession at the time.) The actual underlying cause of the war was trading rights in the lucrative West Indies. After centuries of intermittent and reoccurring war between the English and Spanish, these two maritime powers had managed to work out a trade agreement that ended their conflicts but not their longstanding enmity. In April 1731, the captain of the Spanish caravel La Isabela intercepted and boarded an English brigantine (the Rebecca) near Jamaica that he suspected of being a smuggler. The brig’s goods were looted and the English captain (Robert Jenkins) was consequently tortured throughout that day. When the Spanish captain (Juan Leòn Fandiño) hacked off Jenkins’ ear with a cutlass, he bridled, “Go tell your king that the same will happen to him if he is caught doing the same.” Beyond the bravado or even hubris that convoked such an utterance from el capitán, it would reaffirm the old proverb, “Death and life are in the power of the tongue” because this flippant threat would indeed eventually reach the truculent King George II.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 228 counters

S&T #308, Nov-Dec 2017
197635.name: The War of Jenkins’ Ear

197636.name: Objective Havana
197636.description:
Objective Havana is an operational level, solitaire simulation of the planned-but-never-executed US invasion of Cuba in late 1962. The premise of the game is that President John F. Kennedy had ordered the US military to invade the island in order to remove Soviet missiles and nuclear weapons. Historically, the missiles were removed by a combination of American military and diplomatic pressure (known as the Cuban Missile Crisis), but the game looks at the “what if.” The player controls the US forces; the game system controls the opposing Communist reaction. The objective of the game is for the US to capture Cuba at the lowest possible cost in casualties.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters

Modern War #28, Mar-April 2017

197637.name: Name Chase:  Musical Icons
197637.description:
From the publisher's website:

Players and teams try to name famous singers, bands, composers, and musicians given a series of clues. If you guess the name on the first and most challenging clue, you get 20 points. If you guess the name on the fourth and easiest clue, you get 5 points. The first team or player to 300 points wins the game. Over 500 famous names.

197638.name: Enduring Freedom
197638.description:
Enduring Freedom is an operational-level solitaire simulation of the US-Coalition invasion of Afghanistan in the wake of the 11 September 2001 terrorist attacks in New York and Washington. The player controls the forces of the Coalition (US, NATO, and the Northern Alliance). The game system controls the opposing Islamist forces (Al Qaeda, the Taliban, and Pakistani Volunteers). The objective of the game is for the Coalition to destroy Al Qaeda and establish the basis for a stable Afghanistan such that a new civil war will not break out later. The game covers the period of October 2001 (the initial US invasion) to March 2002 (the conclusion of Operation Anaconda).

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters

Modern War #30, Jul-Aug 2017

197639.description:
Combat Veteran is a simple two-player tactical combat system that simulates the dynamics of infantry combat at the individual (man-to-man) level. This game features two historic scenarios as the introduction to the wider system: Firefight at the Rice Paddy Angle (Vietnam, Mekong region 1967), and Firefight at Combat Outpost Keating (Afghanistan in the Nuristan Province, 2009). Both firefights involved about a platoon of US infantry against an entrenched or numerically superior enemy force. The US and Viet Cong game pieces represent specific, individual (and historic) men of their respective units, whereas Taliban game pieces usually represent several men each. Though the game is meant for two players (one US and one enemy) per scenario, the system allows for multiple players to participate in the same game, allowing each player to control some specific game pieces while another player controls the other pieces on the same side.

Components: Two 22" x 17" maps on one sheet & 280 counters

Modern War #31 Sep-Oct. 2017
197639.name: Combat Veteran

197640.name: Micronaut One
197640.description:
User Summary

A 3D flight game where you have to pilot your ship down the asteroid corridors of a biocomputer, carrying out repairs, while also detail with the scrim infestation.

Developer - Pete Cooke.

197641.name: Pictionary (2013 edition)
197641.description:
Description from the publisher:

Playing Pictionary may remind you of Charades, but with drawing on paper instead of acting out the answers. In Pictionary, though, both teams' (or even all three teams') clue givers may be drawing at the same time as players strive to be the first to guess the correct answer. When the answer is not designated "All Play," one team simply tries to come up with the answer before the timer runs out, which is usually but not always possible thanks to the varying difficulty levels of the answers. No great drawing talent is required; instead, players gain an edge if they have a good imagination when guessing, empathy for their team mates, and/or a general ability to communicate in restricted circumstances. A board is provided, just to keep score on, which focuses the competition. Pictionary was a big hit when it first appeared and has been a classic on the party game scene ever since.

This version of Pictionary, the beloved game of quick sketches and hilarious guesses, features a different board for faster gameplay. There are also two levels of clues (1,200 adult and 800 junior) so that everyone can play. Designed for 3 or more players. Recommended for ages 8 and over.

197642.name: Sushifuda
197642.description:
Sushifuda is a sushi-inspired take on the traditional Hanafuda matching card game from Japan. However, instead of featuring plants and flowers like traditional Hanafuda, Sushifuda depicts kawaii-style sushi art! Collect the most points by matching sushi types and use bonus sashimi 3-card combos for extra points to win!

The game features 12 suits which represent the 12 months, each month containing 4 cards depicting the type of sushi for that month. 2 cards typically are point cards in the suit while the remaining two are normally chaff (no points). There is one wild card called the Gaji or Lightning card which allows you to take non-matching cards.

Games can play with from 2-6 players playing singly or in teams, each round lasting only about 10 minutes. Quick, fast-paced, easy fun from ages 7 and up! You can also play a solo variation.

The cards are marked for Sakura-style play, with point totals and months designated on the cards for instant recognition. Also included are reference cards containing the sashimi bonus point 3-card combos (also known as Yaku). Reference cards are double-sided standard poker playing card size while the main suits cards, which total 48 in number, are half the size, based on traditional Hanafuda. This allows for great portability and also a smaller footprint on your table while playing. All cards and the tuck box come UV coated and linen finished, made of the same cardstock as Magic: The Gathering. Great art collectible, playable cards!

197643.name: Warden: Melody of the Undergrowth
197643.description:
Third-person action-adventure about three protagonists delving into an overgrown civilization and discovering an ancient god. Inspired by genre classics of the N64-era.

Source: The Game Website.

197644.name: Fortify
197644.description:
User Summary

Defend your castle from attacking monsters and siege weapons by using ranged and melee defenders, catapults, cannons, oil fields and more.

197645.name: A Blind Legend
197645.description:
A Blind Legend is the first-ever action-adventure game without video – where ears replace eyes! Discover the original, innovative sensory experience of binaural 3D sound.

Source: The Game Website.

197646.name: Daughter of Shadows: An SCP Breach Event
197646.description:
The player assumes the role of a dangerous and powerful girl known as SCP-029. After a facility wide power outage occurs, numerous SCPs breach containment and proceed to wreak havoc throughout the facility.

Source: The Developer Website.

197647.name: Job Simulator
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Proto Awards Best Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Proto Awards Best Interaction Design of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best VR Game of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Immersive Reality Game of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Immersive Reality Technical Achievement of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best VR/AR Game of the Year Winner
2017 SXSW Best Trending Game of the Year Nominee
197647.description:
In a world where robots have replaced all human jobs, step into the "Job Simulator" to learn what it was like 'to job'

Source: The Game Website.

197648.name: The Rose and I
videogamehonor: 2016 Proto Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
197648.description:
An immersive, animated VR film. Crafted by the artists, animators and storytellers of Penrose Studios, “The Rose And I” is about loneliness, friendship, love, and loss. Come meet a lonely Rose living in the unlikeliest of places, and join her as she transports you to a brand new universe.

Source: The Publisher Website.

197649.name: Space Pirate Trainer
videogamehonor: 2016 Proto Awards Best Game of the Year Winner
2016 Proto Awards Best Independent Experience of the Year Winner
2016 Proto Awards Best Overall Experience of the Year Nominee
2016 Proto Awards Best Sound Design of the Year Winner
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best VR/AR Game of the Year Honorable Mention
2017 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Honorable Mention
197649.description:
Space Pirate Trainer is the official trainer for wannabe space pirates on the HTC Vive. Pick up your blasters, put on your sneakers, and dance your way into the Space Pirate Trainer hall of fame.

Source: The Game Website.

197650.name: R.B.I. Baseball 16
197650.description:
Make the play with your favorite Major League Baseball team and win the World Series! R.B.I. 16 features enhanced lighting and graphics, revamped defensive AI, an improved batting system, and the ability to sim through games in Season mode.

Source: The Publisher Website.

197651.name: Calla's Cruise
197651.description:
Calla's Cruise is a Traveller one-shot scenario for 1-5 players. Designed to be played in a single session, the PCs find themselves working bodyguard on a doomed space-liner.

A massive star-ship, a liner, carries the Baroness Calla and her entourage to the astounding twin-suns of Lylle. Secreted among the passengers are a blood thirsty and heavily armed band of killers ready to target the Baroness. The PCs are all that stands between the killers and the life of everyone on board.

- publishers blurb

197652.name: Era: Lyres – Pocket Rulebook
197652.description:
(publisher blurb)

In Era: Lyres, you are Bards, Rogues and Warriors in the medieval city of Yarnolth. You need to make a living, just like everyone else... but you aren’t dumb enough to go fighting Skeletons and Zombies in crypts, or to tangle with Vampires.

Instead, you stay in the cities (the bars, mostly!), entertaining people with stories of your adventures (which are almost certainly completely untrue!). In return, if you provide them an engaging and entertaining evening, they will reward you with gold and glory – all of the perks of adventuring with none of the risk!

A lot of money and fame can be made by the right group working together in the Yarnolth!

197653.name: Era: Lyres – Deluxe Rulebook
197653.description:
(publisher blurb)

In Era: Lyres, you are Bards, Rogues and Warriors in the medieval city of Yarnolth. You need to make a living, just like everyone else... but you aren’t dumb enough to go fighting Skeletons and Zombies in crypts, or to tangle with Vampires.

Instead, you stay in the cities (the bars, mostly!), entertaining people with stories of your adventures (which are almost certainly completely untrue!). In return, if you provide them an engaging and entertaining evening, they will reward you with gold and glory – all of the perks of adventuring with none of the risk!

A lot of money and fame can be made by the right group working together in the Yarnolth!

This Deluxe Edition contains everything you need to play hundreds of games of Era: Lyres – a selection of stories about Lyres, a guide to character creation and equipment, a Bestiary of creatures to feature in your stories, all of the rules and even sample characters and suggestions for the GM to make things more interesting!

197654.name: PAT: Friends and Buffaloes
197654.description:
User summary:

The game is for five players and one game master. Players in the game control characters who are farmers. The characters must graze their buffalo stock. Farmers have individual goals (generally, to maximize their buffalo herd) and collective goals (to preserve the grasslands) - these goals are fundamentally opposed. The game is played on a grid surface that represents grazing resources. Resources regenerate naturally, but more slowly than they typically are consumed. To simulate the pine tree encroachment, the game master removes usable grids from the game at regular intervals.

197655.name: Samba
197655.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are Vietnamese farmers. The land, previously communally owned and worked, has been subjected to "decollectivization" and a variety of other laws intended to transform agricultural production and resource management. Farmers attempt to maximize commercial exploitation of their land and resources while simultaneously complying with various laws and restraints dealing with resource access and allocation.

197656.name: Bad Moon Rising: The Fight for Fire Base Illingworth, April 1, 1970
197656.description:
April 1st, 1970 was a nightmare that was not supposed to happen. The strategy of using Fire Bases (also termed Fire Support Bases) was created as part of President Nixon’s “Vietnamization” of the conflict in which US forces were gradually withdrawn and the bulk of the fighting turned over to the ARVN (Army of the Republic of [South] Vietnam). General George Casey, Sr. developed the Fire Base strategy in which US Artillery and other battlefield support assets were deliberately deployed in forward areas to disrupt the Communists’ lines of communication and supply, thereby inviting them to attack. Once the enemy was in the open and engaged the US forces would then call in massive amounts of air and artillery support to wreak devastation upon their foe. A Fire Base was only to be in one location 3 to 5 days, and extensive fortifications were not possible as everything had to be removed and redeployed by helicopter in a matter of hours. By April 1st 1970 Fire Base Illingworth had been in place for 11 days, allowing the NVA to completely map-out the American’s positions, size up the garrison, and determine its weak points. Adding to Fire Base Illingworth’s woes was the arrival of thousands of 8 inch artillery rounds on March 31st. The garrison had only hours to provide rudimentary protection for the new ammo dump by the time of the NVA’s attack.

The survivors of Alpha Troop and Charlie Companies who were garrisoning the fire base thought they had reached a place of refuge where they could rest, recuperate, and train their newly arrived replacements (FNGs as they were derisively termed by the veterans). However, the NVA saw the opportunity to exact revenge upon the Americans grow with each passing day Fire Base Illingworth remained in place.

197657.name: Swords in the Sewers
197657.description:
Publisher Blurb:
In the dirt-ridden tunnels below the city, deformed evils stir and a race of ratmen long thought gone prepare to rise. Raised from filthy warrens and despoiled ground, the scourge gathers amidst the crumbling sewers and ruined waterways of a once-bright empire. The malevolent ratmen from the tunnels below come alive with this stunning Lost Lore collection for use with your fantasy RPG!

Includes: 9 Creatures, 11 Token bases, 2 Player maps, 6 GM aids

197658.name: Baker Street Casebook #2: Missions From Mycroft
197658.description:
Publisher Blurb

Missions from Mycroft is the second collection of cases for the Baker Street roleplaying game. Work for Mycroft Holmes on missions of international importance!

Sherlock’s older, smarter brother needs your help. Featuring 8 new adventures of the utmost importance. The investigators have their work cut out for them! Can they solve these mysteries? Can they save the Queen? Let’s find out!

197659.name: Sherlock by Gaslight
197659.description:
Publisher Blurb

Sherlock by Gaslight is the first campaign guide for the Baker Street roleplaying game. It features a London sourcebook and includes the Jack the Ripper campaign.

Whitechapel 1888, prostitutes are being murdered in London’s east end. Your investigators are hired to solve the world’s most famous unsolvable crime! Jack the Ripper is hiding in the Shadows. He replaces Dr. Moriarty on the Sherlock Die, and fuels your fears the closer you get to the truth! This sourcebook features all new professions for investigators, several new reprobates for the Mastermind, and over 50 London locations, each with a unique plot hook that can be converted to a whole night of who dunnits!

197660.name: Lords of the Fallen - Ancient Labyrinth
197660.description:
Discover a new campaign in the long-forgotten library, locked away between the human and demonic realms millennia ago. Uncover the mysteries hidden in the maze’s corridors and lay waste to the undead followers of the fallen god roaming within it. Find your way to the most powerful Lord in the Rhogar army and end his demonic reign.

Source: The Game Website.

197661.name: SelfCormas
197661.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are either farmers or animal husbandry specialists. They live in a shared environment with decentralized control and must manage their respective interests in the community. Generally, intensive land use with a goal of maximum commercial exploitation is assumed. Conflict arises because farming and animal husbandry require disparate approaches to land use and resource management.

Play involves collaborative creation of the map, identification of player characters, and the general scenario. Usually, the game attempts to mirror the local geography and population. The game rules allow for modification - "According to the principle of adaptive and collective validation, a rule can be modified, deleted, or added during the game, if all players agree".

197664.name: Stratagènes
197664.description:
User summary:

The game requires seven players that are assigned different characters, primarily identified by their role. Two characters are local farmers, one is a park ranger, one represents a non-governmental organization (NGO), one is an industrialist, one is a scientist, and one is a mediator. The game uses a setting modeled on the geology, geography, and patrilineal culture of Madagascar. Play proceeds through six game turns, each representing one year in game time. Character activities are based on motivations which, sometimes, contradict with other character desires.

197665.name: SugarRice
197665.description:
User summary:

The game is played over two sessions. In the first session players collaboratively detail the play region (an agrarian community in northeast Thailand), it's topography, and its geology. They also divide the play region into parcels and then determine which crops are allocated to which parcel. The two major crops are sugarcane and rice, though others are available.

The second session involves the creation of characters (generally, all local farmers) and is played in rounds where characters make harvest and planting decisions, as well as disposing of their harvests at a commercial market. Every two turns, the players have the option to modify the game rules - the game subsequently proceeds under the new rules, if any.

197666.name: Hover Junkers
197666.description:
User Summary

Hover Junkers is a VR-only multiplayer combat game in which players pilot small flying platforms with the aim of collecting junk in a futuristic wasteland. Combat as teams or go head-to-head against other junk collectors while you use the junk you find to better your ship.

197667.name: SylvoPast
197667.description:
User summary:

The setting consists of one hundred plots of forest terrain, and is described by its grass, shrub, and tree vegetation. Player characters are farmers, hunters, or foresters. Each of these types have various goals, including maximizing commercial exploitation (primarily through planting and grazing), deriving taxable income (primarily from grazing permits), or sporting enjoyment. Many of these goals are conflicting.

The game also introduces periodic fires into certain parcels. These fires remove that plot from all use for a defined period of time, further restraining available resources and options. The game is played in phases, during which the seasons change and, thus, possible land uses change in a variable (but predictable) way.

197672.name: NHL SuperCard
197672.description:
NHL SuperCard, the action-packed NHL collectible card-battling game

Offering more than 450 cards featuring current and legendary NHL players in active circulation, with each card representing different rarity levels, NHL SuperCard offers a wealth of collectible content, extensive replay value and opportunities to purchase individual card packs.

Source: The Publisher Website.

197675.name: Protodimension (Issue 24 - Jan 2016)
197675.description:
Protodimension Magazine
Issue 24
January 2016

This issue, the first in Volume 7, marks the transition from a quarterly to an intended monthly. It also marks the first time the magazine was produced in both PDF and EPUB versions.

197677.name: Yarloop
197677.description:
Southeast of Perth Western Australia, lies the little timber town of Yarloop. Behind it are the forests of the Darling Ranges. For more than 100 years, the people of Yarloop milled timber from that forest, brought to their saw mills by a network of tramways.

Yarloop is a tile laying game where players try to place their worker on newly discovered timber coups or the expanding tram network in an effort to score points faster than everyone else.

Each player has one meeple. The Draw stack contains only 15 double sided tiles. Once the stack is empty, players pick up a tile that is already placed, flip it over and place it in new position on the map. They may then move their meeple and check for scoring.

The first to score 40 points is the winner.

197678.name: Election Day 2016
197678.description:
Simulate the historic election of 2016 with Election Day 2016.

Play as Donald Trump or Hillary Clinton as the two candidates fight it out for the majority of Electoral Votes. Or, if you prefer, try Ted Cruz, Bernie Sanders, Marco Rubio, or even Joe Biden in this game of electoral politics.

Players customize a deck of cards unique to their party. By fighting over fifteen swing states--or more!--players try and gain support by mastering issues such as Health Care or Income Inequality, appealing to demographics like Single Women or Libertarians, and mold the political landscape by changing a Region's focus from, say Economic concerns to Foreign Affairs.

Spin random events so they come out in your favor. Manipulate the media so your issues come out on top. Build Grassroots Support to surprise your opponent on election day. Pick from four different Vice Presidential candidates to give your campaign a boost.

Do whatever it takes to win the White House in November!

NOTE: Print and play instructions are located in the forum.

197679.name: Crown of Exile
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode #11 – Crown of Exile
197679.description:
Chaos reigns in the wake of the king's death. People are starving, the roads are dangerous to travel and the nation's foreign enemies have begun to stir at the borders. The kingdom cries out for a new ruler - and you are the head of a minor house who intend to answer that call... if you can do so before your adversaries take what should be yours.

Now is your chance. Restore order under your rule and claim the throne for yourself.

In Crown of Exile players compete to seize control of a kingdom at the verge of a dark age while guarding themselves from opponents with ambitions of their own, and underhanded ways of interfering.

Crown of Exile is a game for 2-5 players that takes 90 minutes to play. The rules are simple to learn but offer a depth of strategy that will keep both experienced gamers and newcomers scheming and plotting over and over again.

How to Play:

Crown of Exile is a game about developing your domain and deciding when you have built enough to risk taking on quests. Move too quickly and your opponents might interfere, leaving you unable to fulfill your quests, but move too slowly and someone else will take what could have been yours. You can be an aggressor and try to steal what others have as a means to victory, subtly manipulate the flow of the game with political influence, or trade to gain enormous resources quickly, but give your rivals the opportunity to profit.

In Crown of Exile players begin with a hand of cards representing their domain - a treasury, serfs, nobles, and infantry, they also begin with a knight and a construction card. Unlike other deckbuilding games Crown of Exile gives you access to all of your drafted cards, but limits players to only four each round, forcing players to balance generating resources versus expansion and conquest.

Each round players will use four of their cards to generate resources, attack, trade, draft new cards and complete quests that will grant them various bonuses, including titles and victory points needed to win the game.

Once completed, quests require you to pay an upkeep cost to maintain the order and control you have established, and keep the advantages provided by those quests. So as you gain power and complete more quests your resources will become strained- and your opponents may attempt to sabotage you and try to steal your quests by preventing you from gaining the necessary resources.

At the end of every round players pay their upkeeps and gain bonuses based on their titles and quests and then pick up all of their cards and begin another round. Play continues until one player has achieved the rank of "Prince" or 8 rounds have elapsed.

197680.name: The Spellbook of the Uruks
197680.description:
From publisher blurb:

Violent sorcery of a violent people, these are the curses of Arahk Gnahk.

197681.name: Treasury of the Macabre (5E)
197681.description:
From publisher blurb:

Treasures from the Crypt
The Treasury of the Macabre is a collection of 30 haunted and horrible magic items designed for a horror-themed 5E game, like the official 5th Edition Curse of the Vampire adventure saga or any campaign exploring the mist-shrouded Loft of Ravens. This tome of treasures includes items any vampire or vampire-hunter would be delighted to discover, in addition to items themed for a wide variety of horror scenarios, from witches, werewolves, ghostly haunted houses, and mad scientists and their creepy constructs (like those featured in the Construct Codex from Legendary Games), to ancient liches and cosmic cults devoted to eldritch entities from beyond the stars! Whatever flavor of horror you want to include in your 5E game, the Treasury of the Macabre has got treasures worth winning, from the beyonder's veil and clockthief's candelabrum to the witchblood stylus and sanguinary torque. Grab this 20-page PDF and Make Your Horror Game Legendary!

197682.name: Tomes of Ancient Knowledge (5E)
197682.description:
From publisher blurb:

Secrets Man Was Not Meant to Know

Tomes of Ancient Knowledge introduces an entirely new flavor of magic for the 5th Edition of the world's most famous roleplaying game, especially a horror-themed game like the official 5th Edition Curse of the Vampire adventure saga or any campaign exploring the mist-shrouded Loft of Ravens. This product details a simplified sanity system that enables your players to experience the slow crumbling of their grip on reality but without making their characters unplayable. It also expands the basic concepts of existing magic and how to reshape common spells into mind-bending abominations that anyone foolish enough to attempt can unleash upon an unsuspecting world. Besides these broader themes, Tomes of Ancient Knowledge brings you a trio of eldritch books of magic, each delving into a different theme, from the deranged poetry of pain in the Palestone Analects to the cosmic secrets of space and time in the Xanthuun Tablets and the crystalline record of a blood-soaked serpent cult in the Sarkulis Shards. With 16 brand-new spells and a bounty of unique magical mysteries, there is knowledge here, and power, but the deeper you delve the greater the cost, but is any price too great to claim the power of the ancients? Grab this 16-page PDF today, if you dare!

197684.name: Apothecary Plaguewright Archetype
197684.description:
From publisher blurb:

Despite the fact that the vast majority of plaguewrights are either benign practitioners of their own brand of esoterica or actively working for the betterment of their fellow man, the name sticks. It sticks because of the handful of lunatics who actually brew and unleash plagues. It sticks because of the visibility of the negative, because of confirmation bias itself.

In the end, the only way to move forward is to walk away from the name altogether. The apothecary is a specialized plaguewright who gives up a large portion of his ability to do harm in exchange for additional support and healing options. Creative physicians, benevolent mad scientists, and the like fall under the umbrella of the apothecary. Do you?

197685.name: Avalon Spell Book 3
197685.description:
From publisher blurb:

Avalon takes a common spell and provides you with a number of alterations and additions to add excitement and useful options for your next adventure. Each issue of Avalon Spell Books will focus on a new spell, discussing different versions of the spell, providing different components that can be used to alter the way the spell works, and even adding feats and new magical items linked to the spell in question.

This month we have Mist Magic.

Obscuring mist and fog cloud spells have long been iconic examples of low-level magic powers, widely renowned for their ability to make a mess of the battlefield, turning combat into a game of hide-and-seek.

Many spellcasters still frown upon the clouds that hinder them as much as their opponents, choosing more direct affect spells to prepare. No surprise that divine spellcasters are sometimes found most heretically grumbling at the unavoidable obscuring mist spell in their domain spell lists.

Yet some curious researchers have delved deeper into the secrets of mists, finding ways to improve their eyesight, get new summonable monsters and shape cloud dwellings. They have found ways to do things, normally impossible at windier places with better view, where mist doesn't stay long enough.

197686.name: Avalon Spell Book 4
197686.description:
From publisher blurb:

Avalon takes a common spell and provides you with a number of alterations and additions to add excitement and useful options for your next adventure. Each issue of Avalon Spell Books will focus on a new spell, discussing different versions of the spell, providing different components that can be used to alter the way the spell works, and even adding feats and new magical items linked to the spell in question.

This month we have Phantom of a Trap.

How much damage can a trap cause that does nothing?

This is the question that comes into mind when you start looking for a best placing of the Phantom Trap spell. The answer, of course, is in the trap’s surroundings. Distractions, misleading clues, and red herrings are all good only when there are other traps or creatures that can take advantage of them. Making intruders waste time, dispel magic spells, and use up other resources is perfectly fine if they are going to have an encounter where they could have put these valuable assets to better use. Used a bit of your Luck ability to improve an unexplainably failing Disable Device check? You might mourn when you need it a few rounds later.

While many dabblers in Spellcraft know that a lock or hinge can have a false trap, few expect the same from an arrow slit or a crossbeam. The variant spell components provided below can help one make a better surprise of this simple illusion.

Lastly, Phantom Traps and other diversions can be combined with real traps. While designing such encounters, one needs a bit longer preparation than normal, but it really pays off when you have intruders struggle with a false trap and a real one comes upon them undetected and unexpected. The “Sample Traps” section at the end of this Spell Book provides some examples of magical and mechanical combinations that increase chances of a real trap working properly rather than getting routinely disarmed by the first rogue that comes upon it.

197688.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 5, Issue 14 - Dart)
197688.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This week: A new hero to play or add as an NPC to your supers game.

197690.name: Classic Fantasy
197690.description:
From publisher blurb:

Classic Fantasy brings Old School dungeon crawls to the Mythras and RuneQuest 6 rules. This 336 page book contains everything you need to emulate the fun of class and level-based adventuring, against the classic coterie of monsters, with the classic armoury of spells! If you've ever wanted to convert those old dungeon modules to a d100 system, then Classic Fantasy is for you.

Packed with information and new rules additions, Classic Fantasy features a different approach to character creation based on classes such as the bard, cavalier, fighter, magic user, paladin and thief. Choose your race - human or demi-human - and then customize according to class, race and personal preference. If you're a magic user or cleric, the new magic rules for Arcane and Divine spells take the old staples such as Magic Missile, Charm, Fireball and more, and tailor them for the nuances of the Mythras and RQ6 systems.

Or, for the more combat-oriented, the Classic Fantasy rules provide detailed miniatures-based combat adaptations for the traditional battle-board, complete with guidance on facings, positioning, and handling detailed movement.

And of course, no book like this would be complete without monsters to kill and treasure to take! All the old favourites are accounted for, from Basilisks to Displacer Cats, Grey Ooze to Gelatinous Masses, Kobolds, Gnolls, Hobgoblins and more. Forty pages of treasure and magic items helps you equip even the deepest dungeon with enough loot to satisfy the keenest adventuring party.

This is not a standalone game. Games Masters and players will need access to either the Mythras or RQ6 rules to play Classic Fantasy (although other d100 rule systems may suffice).

So break out the Cheetos and Mountain Dew - Classic Fantasy is Here!

197691.name: Ghosts in Darkness
197691.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ghosts in Darkness is an introductory scenerios designed to provide a starting point for new campaigns.

It is meant to introduce the GM and players to the primary elements of the Nova Praxis setting while also setting up a chilling villain that can haunt the PCs for years to come.

Missing and presumed dead, the PC's minds are restored from backup. They awake with no memory of what happened to them, and all records of their prior activity have been mysteriously wiped. Can they solve the mystery of their own disappearance? And will they survive the horror they uncover?

Ghosts in Darkness was originally released in Machinations, for the Fate version of Nova Praxis. This version is for the Savage Worlds version.

197692.name: White Moon Cove (System Neutral Edition)
197692.description:
From publisher blurb:

White Moon Cove is a respectable fishing village set in a sheltered cove which acts as an excellent, natural harbour. The inhabitants of this tightly-knit community are sober, hardworking and amiable fishermen, traders and other sturdy folk making their living from the sea. Despite being a fairly peaceful and law-abiding place, White Moon Cove still hold many opportunities for adventure, from rumours of secret smuggler activity to an ancient and possibly haunted lighthouse. Yet, perhaps the most famous reason for White Moon Cove's notoriety is the mysterious underwater edifice known as the Sunken Pyramid which lies hidden far beneath the waves a few miles out to sea.

197693.description:
Cheeky Monkeys is a card game where ape trainers have to manage dangerous monkeys. Players take turns getting a monkey and drawing one action card.
The game gets more and more intense with each monkey you take because every ape has a peculiar effect and can interact with others creating various combinations.
The game goes on until you manage to blow other players up with some deadly monkey combinations or blast yourself in the intent. The last surviving ape-trainer is the winner. The action deck is made up of cards that let you avoid exploding or create troubles to your play-mates. You need to play the right action card at the right time and use all your creativity and (basic) science knowledge to win this highly-strategic Monkey-enthusiastic game.
197693.name: Cheeky Monkeys

197694.name: Over the Top: The Eastern Front
197694.description:
From publisher blurb:

2364: The war, mostly on the continent of Magos, between the Elven Compact and the Alliance of Many. Now nearly a year old, the Great War has seen trench lines divide Magos and war divide her nations. Across the continent the magic of Magos’ antiquity mixes with the industry of her today, producing monstrous mechanisms for a conflict with no end in sight.

In the east of Magos, the ancient monarchies of Alheim and Durwuz Ruf have plunged their countries into the world war which has engulfed Magos. The Eastern Front of the Great War is a grim frontier battle, stretched across the broad and wild borders of Durwuz Ruf and forced by geography into a grim and narrow point with Alheim constantly tittering on the brink of conquest. The Dwarvern army of Durwuz Ruf has become notorious for its hard-fighting infantry and bear-mounted cavalry. The Easter Front features:

A companion to existing background in the Character Primer and Guide to the Past.
An overview of the geography of the Eastern Front, and details of precisely how its warfare differs from the Western.
All new monsters and magic items specific to Over the Top’s World War One themed setting.
A brand new class to suit the Eastern Front’s frontier-like battles, the Scout.

197695.name: Addendum: Shape Shifting
197695.description:
From publisher blurb:

Change yourself and you change the world.

Learn what forms to be wary of lest you end up an unthinking rock, locked into that form forever. Discover which shape’s gifts are intrinsic to a Gossamer world, and which can work on the Grand Stair and beyond another Door! Retain your own sense of self, or risk becoming the very mask you wear via the power of Shape Shifting.

Shape Shifting is a new Lesser Power which confers the gifts of adaptability, change, and of course switching from one form to another. Many worlds feature Shape Shifters be they gods, monsters, or whole races unto themselves. Will you be one of them?

Four tiers of this power are described here:

Lesser Shape Shifting: Take on a single alternate form and with practice a hybrid of that form.
Shape Shifting: Assume a variety of bodily types and transformational abilities, hindered by some unique drawbacks.
Advanced Shape Shifting: Gain amazing malleable abilities, a veritable protean form able to assume an incredible variety of shapes, specific beings, and even more unique aspects, shrugging off most of the normal drawbacks of Shape Shifting.
Exalted Shape Shifting: A level of the power that is extraordinarily rare, and may be reserved for beings akin to gods.




Addendum: Shape Shifting can be used in any game based on Erick Wujcik's Diceless Role-Playing, existing alongside powers such as Sorcery and making great use of the Endurance Attribute. Allowing you to seamlessly enhance your new or existing game with a wondrous ability.

197696.name: Super Arcade Football
197696.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.





Super Arcade Football is a fast action, modern awakening of the classic football genre.An arcade football game like never before, with as much pace as a cross from Ronaldo, and as much power as a headbutt from Zidane. Play with up to 4 friends locally, with intense scorelines, dynamic gameplay and crazy fun. No real-life simulation, no micro transactions, just pure arcade football action!

Features:
Controlled shooting with our advanced ‘Slow-Mo- Banana-Bending-Technology’ ™
Guaranteed amazing goals!
4 Player Local Multiplayer - Play with friends competitively or cooperatively
Very relaxed referees - No offside rule!
Don’t actually need to like football to play! (but if you do , good on you!)
Spontaneous weather conditions.
Lots of Pitch types / teams - Each with their own affect on gameplay.
Normal Time + Golden Goal Mode (First goal wins)
Smooth controls
Slow Motion Goals

Source: The Developer Website.

197697.description:
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks (though there some 'lucky' cards in with the Tourist cards which offer this facility) - but you can travel by air, BNG express or Rotterdam light railway for extra advantage.

There are many new options in the rules: run 2 routes into 1, exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
197697.name: Netherlands (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

197698.name: Surfingers
197698.description:
User Summary

You control the ocean sections, making them go up or down so that your surfer can go from one section to another without changing level. There are obstacles to avoid and stars to gather, but the main aim is to go as far as you can without crashing.

197700.name: Light Repair Team #4
197700.description:
Light Repair Team #4 is a light-reflection puzzle game where you play as a light-pipe repair person. Figure out how to properly bounce, combine and split light so that you can return power to nearby buildings.

Source: The Developer Website.

197701.name: Holodance
197701.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Are you ready to write a new history of the future? Let three friendly dragons take you on a journey through rhythm and sound in this collaborative multiplayer Virtual Reality rhythm game! Show them if you have what it takes to meet ... her.

Source: The Game Website.

197702.name: The Fifth Expedition
197702.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Guide your team of explorers into the treacherous depths of an ancient machine. On a mission to restore the old mechanisms to life and to save your people on the surface, who rely on the age old construct for food and shelter.

Source: The Game Website.

197703.name: Axes and Acres
197703.description:
Axes and Acres is a deep and engaging single-player strategy game designed to create exciting decisions every turn. The rules are easy to learn, but every turn can be played out in many different ways in order to farm, build and survive.

Source: The Developer Website.

197704.name: Glitchrunners
197704.description:
Chaotic, five player mayhem takes over in Glitchrunners.

Source: The Game Website.

197705.description:
In Defense Grid: The Board Game, a cooperative deck-building game based on the Defense Grid video game franchise, players must face off against waves and waves of aliens as they try to #ProtectTheCores. How you construct your deck for each mission is just as important as where you place your towers and which ones you choose to power each round.

Defense Grid: The Board Game includes at least ten missions and six AI characters from which to choose. Over the course of the game, players unlock new AI improvements, AI abilities, towers, and cards that they can use to go for the Gold Medal on each mission as they fight to #ProtectTheCores.
197705.name: Defense Grid: The Board Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: 26 Devon Dice podcast season 2 Sub Terra, sub DOOM and sub monsters
Strange Assembly 192 - Live From GenCon 2016

197706.name: Speed Art
197706.description: In Speed Art, the cards have six categories on them such as landscape, sculpture, or seated figure, but on the face-down side that players don't see. Players race to try to guess which cards match in which categories.

197707.description:
Description from the publisher:

R'lyeh is a terrible and ancient city, risen from the depths of the Pacific by a great curse. There, Cthulhu lies both dead and dreaming, waiting to consume any who venture near.

In Lost in R'lyeh, players are trapped in H.P. Lovecraft's short story, "The Call of Cthulhu". From the mysterious discovery of a profane idol, to dreams of a dark cult, to landfall in a cyclopean metropolis and Cthulhu's horrific emergence, no player can truly win...although the last player to escape will be the ultimate loser for that player will be forever lost in R'lyeh!

In terms of the gameplay, each turn choose to play either event cards and horror cards. Play the largest card sets you can to unlock ever-mightier powers. When the time is right, transition from playing cards from your hand to eliminating your array of escape cards. What's more, decide each turn whether picking up the whole stack will help you win, even though you're ultimately trying to get rid of cards.
197707.name: Lost in R'lyeh

197708.name: prog.1
197708.description:
prog.1 is a 2D puzzle platformer designed around a core mechanic: you play an anthropomorphic computer virus that infects virtually everything it touches, pun intended.

Source: The Game Website.

197709.name: Ratchet & Clank (2016)
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Platformer Game of the Year Winner
2016 Golden Geek Best PS4 Game Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Nominee
2016 The Game Awards Best Family Game of the Year Nominee
2017 British Academy Game Awards Best Family/Children's Game of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Family Game of the Year Winner
197709.description:
The game's plot is based upon elements from the original Ratchet & Clank game and the upcoming animated feature film, which incorporates elements from later entries in the series. It is said to include a deeper origin story and over an hour of cutscenes, including footage from the film.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ratchet_%26_Clank_%282016_video_game%29 Ratchet & Clank (2016 video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

197710.description:
After many years in space, the crew of the colony ship Dorchester crash-land on a remote alien world. Splitting into different factions, the colonists build a new civilization dominated by powerful heroes, leaders, and figures of influence.

Age of Primes is an episodic, story-driven customizable card game with a unique science-fiction setting. Players take on different personas, recruit followers, and compete to accumulate Prestige for their House. The first player to amass 25 Prestige wins.
197710.name: Age of Primes

197711.description:
Players cooperate to catch the thief who stole the King's magic ring. To catch the thief, players need gather information about them. But time is working against them, so they need to have a good memory and a little luck to catch the thief before time runs out.

After the portable dice game and the card game version of the electronic boardgame, this is a version with a spinner, a standing clock and food types already printed on the suspect cards. This game was distributed as part of the McDondald's Happy Meals Menu from 2nd to 12th November 2015 in Austria.
197711.name: Wer war's Happy Meal edition

197712.description:
For centuries, the heroes of the world have used the power of Millennium Blades trading cards to protect the world from evil. The most powerful weapons in their arsenal were Fusion Cards – cards that combined the incredible powers hidden away within the game, bringing out their true potential. With the world in chaos once more, a new champion must master Card Fusion in order to defend earth!

Using your collection of trading cards and mystical Fusion Gems in Card Fusion Chaos, you combine cards together to create the most unbalanced, overpowered cards you can imagine. Clash with your rival to uncover shards of the Master Fusion Gem. The first player who can acquire enough shards to assemble the Master Gem will be declared the new champion of earth!

Card Fusion Chaos includes more than eighty already-overpowered trading cards that you can combine into more than 350,000 unique fusion combinations!
197712.name: Card Fusion Chaos

197713.name: BLEAK: Welcome to Glimmer
197713.description:
User Summary

Comes with a complete original soundtrack, 20+ Levels, and Multiple playable characters.

197714.name: Silver Bullet: Prometheus
197714.description:
https://www.facebook.com/theSilverBulletGame/

Infiltrate the military research lab consipiring with the devil and hunt down the demons! Kali, the legendary "Goddess of Death" in the South America Rovolution. She joined Neverlight, the counter-demon organization, after some kind of incident.

197715.name: Tenrow
197715.description:
Tenrow is a logic puzzle game. Includes 50 levels.

Source: The Developer Website.

197716.name: Binaries
197716.description:
Test your reflexes and awareness as you simultaneously guide two lovable balls through 101 brightly coloured challenges in the world's first concentration platformer. Control both at exactly the same time using the same set of controls and watch out for hazards. Oh, and there are jokes!

Source: The Game Website.

197717.name: Void 21
197717.description:
Void 21 is a procedurally generated, arcade style, fast-paced runner and shooter. You are a pilot training with the highly maneuverable and lethal Void ship. Your objective is to reach the end of the level, either as quickly or as violently as possible (or both?).

Source: The Game Website.

197718.name: Impulse!
197718.description:
Impulse! is a unique musical murder mystery that follows Chris and his band, Impulse! through their first ever live show. After a local musician is murdered, the band decide to step in to figure out who the murderer is. Impulse!

Source: The Developer Website.

197719.name: Atriage
197719.description:
Atriage, a turn-based strategy game inspired by Sci-fi space naval battles in 80s Anime where you command a fleet of ten warships against a rival commander. Master four different ship classes, each with their own strengths, weaknesses, and roles in combat in an all-out battle for supremacy.

Source: The Developer Website.

197720.name: Chicku
197720.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Chicku is a nail bitingly hard platformer in which the player has to escape the evil Barrington farm. You'll be forced to dodge saws, spikes and many other deadly traps in order to save your brethren and rise against the evil Dr. Barrington.

Source: The Developer Website.

197721.name: Slime Jumper
197721.description:
User Summary

You can buy different slimes with stars collected while playing the levels.

197722.name: Amsgolf
videogameversion: English / European Amstrad CPC 3" Disk edition
English / European Amstrad CPC Compact Cassette edition
French / European Amstrad CPC 3" Disk edition
German / European Amstrad CPC Compact Cassette edition
Spanish / European Amstrad CPC Compact Cassette edition
197722.description:
From the Inlay:

Welcome to the Amsoft Golf Course

This exciting new computer simulation of an 18 hole golf course will enable you to improve your skill level of the game, in other words, lower your handicap.

User Summary

This golf game is played from a top-down perspective when playing from the tee or fairway, switching to a side-on view when putting.

For each stroke, the player enters the club, the angle and the strength. The computer then shows the result of the shot. In a bunker, the sand-wedge is assumed, and on the green a putter is assumed. On the green, the direction is also assumed and the player only needs to select the power.

At the conclusion of the round, the player's score is compared against the par for the course and their handicap. If they have beaten the par plus their handicap, then they are given a new, lower handicap. This is accompanied by a code, which can be entered at the start of a new game to play at the lower handicap. The ultimate aim is to reduce your handicap to "scratch" (0).

197723.name: Pusher Gnomes
197723.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Pusher Gnome is a specialist who has applied his or her innate racial talents to the manufacture and distribution of special Gnomish drugs. These drugs are so incredible that they can sometimes seem to have nearmagical effects, though they are in fact completely mundane in their nature and origin. Of course, being Gnomes, the Pushers are not always successful in creating the drugs and unforeseen and (sometimes) dangerous side effects are not at all uncommon.

Written for Lamentations of the Flame Princess, but compatible with all OSR systems, the world of Meatlandia is bloody and horrific and just a little gonzo. This is a modern OSR take on old Weird fantasy pulp worldbuilding.

197724.name: HLS Sentinel
197724.description:
From publisher blurb:

HLS Sentinel is a heavily armed patrol scout vessel belonging to the Helian League. The Helian League, a loose Federation of the colonised planets of the Solar System, require fast, well armed and armoured patrol vessels to ensure Helian space remains secure and the HLS Sentinel is well placed to meet this role. With dedicated gun control decks, the HLS Sentinel can quickly destroy interlopers that it encounters on it's long patrol missions.


A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Sci-Fi or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The ship occupies approximately 20x20 tiles.

Contents: A small spacecraft, with a military design. The central area links the bridge to two nacelles, each housing an engine (with engineering room) and dedicated gun control decks. The rear of the ship has living and recreation areas for the crew.

Uses: HLS Sentinel could be crewed by a team of military personel, and could either be the location for a fierce ship-boarding action or the vessel for long-range exploration.

Download includes:
300dpi A4 pdf, with map spread across 4 pages for easy printing.
300dpi full jpeg version for VTT or poster printing

197725.name: Blood Will Run
197725.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Poisoned Pages Adventure for Novice Characters

Darkness has come to Cheqwood, a mere speck of a town on the edges of an enchanted wood, a place steeped in the old magic of the fey folk that now stands on the precipice of annihilation thanks to the attentions of the devils and their cruel machinations. With beastmen stalking the countryside, ghosts loosed from the Underworld to haunt the lands of the living, children mysteriously vanishing, and a curious stranger named the Bonesmith, the rising tensions might very well cause the hard-won peace of this frontier community to unravel into violence and death.

Blood Will Run is an adventure written for novice characters. In it, the group becomes embroiled in a mystery involving the disappearance of twin boys and the theft of a valuable blade. The deeper the characters investigate, the more horror they uncover until they can drag the true villain into the light.

197726.name: Borgar Beardbellow
197726.description:
From publisher blurb:

Snapshot Statement

Borgar is a lawful neutral male dwarf with skald levels utilizing the herald of the horn archetype. He specializes in wind and song performances and wields battle and throwing axes. His magical abilities focus upon enchantment and augmenting the combat skills of himself and others.

Product Overview

Oops! That six-hour marathon game session started 15 minutes ago, and you have already killed a player character (PC)! He was decapitated while being consumed in dragon fire, and his corpse fell into a sphere of annihilation. Your prediction for recovery is “not likely.” You built pre-generated characters for this campaign six months and four character levels ago! You don’t want your player to sit and read the newspaper for the next 5.75 hours. You need a comparable-level character sheet quickly.

OR… A new player has just shown up to your table willing to learn to sling dice. You found out he or she was coming thirty minutes before game time. Your regular crew of miscreants has already killed off all the spare pre-generated characters you rolled up with gleeful abandon, while cackling wildly and uttering something about “drive ‘em like you stole ‘em.” You want this first gaming experience to be fun and memorable, so you don’t want to completely wing it. You need a character sheet, right now.

Welcome to Instant Character! Just add a player, and go! In this product, you will discover twenty complete stat blocks for a single PC, level 1 through 20, adhering to the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game rules. The core format adheres to the standard non-player character (NPC) stat block most GMs are already familiar with minus the Tactics section. This makes it easier for the GM to assist with finding information and also prepares the player for the day he or she is running games!
