The Special Abilities section includes more detailed write-ups of feats and character abilities than a standard NPC stat block to facilitate faster play. Sources for spells, races, classes, archetypes, and prestige classes from sources other than the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ (PZO1110) are listed in the Sources section and can be referenced in the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Reference Document.

At the end of this document is a sheet of character and spell tokens including a token for this character and assorted Non-Player Characters (NPCs) and spell effects. For best results, print the token page and laminate the entire sheet. Initially cut out into squares. To improve ability to move and pick up the laminated tokens, trim off the gray corners to make an octagonal shape.

197727.name: Highland Games
197727.description:
From the box:
"Explore & Discover Scottish Heritage & History. You don't have to be Scottish to enjoy the game."

User description:
The game contains 48 cards in each of five categories:

Myths & Legends;
Tartans & Clans;
Rhymes & Pastimes;
Regiments & Castles; and
People, Places & Events.




There is also a six-sided die with a different color on each face, plus a smaller set of cards called "The Sporran" and another called "The Laird's Castle", both of which have special instructions on them.

On his/her turn each player rolls the die and attempts to answer the question on a card in the category with the matching color. If successful, the player then draws a Sporran card and follows the directions there. This could be to roll the die again and answer another question, or proceed directly to the Laird's Castle. Cards in the Castle set have further instructions, or the game could end if the player turns up the "Chief's Badge" card.

When four or more players are involved, the instructions suggest forming teams.

197728.name: We're the Scots!
197728.description:
From the box:
"Scotland's Trivia Quiz Game. A Fun Game To Test Your Knowledge Of Scotland And The Scots."

We're the Scots! can be played either by individuals competing against one another, or teams of players competing against one another. ... Play commences with the first questioner (the player on the immediate right of the starting player) drawing the first card from the end of the pack which displays the photo-image. The starting player is then asked the 6 questions on that card in sequence. The questions are graded by degree of perceived difficulty from 1 to 6. The points awarded for correct answers correspond to the number of the question, i.e. question one scores 1 point, question two scores 2 points, question three scores 3 points, etc. ...
On all cards Question 4 (highlighted in yellow) relates to the illustration on the facing side. When it comes to this question, the questioner should read from the card, then hold up the illustration to provide the answering player with a clear view. ... Players should be afforded a reasonable opportunity to answer each question in their own time. Nevertheless, when an answer does not appear to be forthcoming, the questioner may introduce a time-limit using the one-minute timer provided in the game. A player who is unable to supply an answer within the period forfeits the points for that question....
The winning player is the one achieving the highest score. (From the instructions)

197729.name: Dreadhalls
197729.description:
You will wake up in a scarcely lit dungeon. Find its exit, and avoid the creatures that dwell in it. Your only weapons will be stealth, your own courage, and a faint light that you’ll have to keep fed with oil, lest you want the darkness to engulf you.

Source: The Game Website.

197730.name: Star Wars World
197730.description:
User summary:

Free Apocalypse World hack for Star Wars roleplaying.

197731.name: Qal
197731.description:
From the instruction sheet:
"Qal" -- pronounced "Cal" -- is a Bible-times word that means "to remember." Qal in an interesting and challenging game of memory -- one where even younger non-readers can compete effectively with adults and teens. ...
The object of the game is to find and match as many of the 18 different Bible symbols as possible. When played for advanced learning, the secondary object is to find the Bible verse which is referenced by the matched symbol. ...
After all symbols have been matched, players count the number of markers they have collected to determine the winner.

197732.name: Balancing Ladders
197732.description: In the classic fashion of several dexterity games, the colorful ladders must be stacked very carefully in such a way that the resulting tower does not overbalance and tip over.

197733.name: Brave 4 in 1 Game Box
197733.description:
From the box:
"Enjoy hours of fun! Use these playing cards to play the exciting action game, or a number of other card games! Use the cards to build images as fast as you can in the Mega Memo Game or make a fun puzzle!"

User description:

The box contains two sizes of cards: one 16-card set that is 90mm x 125mm (approximately 3-3/8 x 4-3/4), and one 52-card "bridge-size" deck (63mm x 88mm) split into two packets. The large cards are two-sided -- one side has a portion of a larger picture, while the other side has portraits of the various characters from the Pixar movie "Brave", along with assorted numbers and symbols.

In addition to the standard suit and number markings on the smaller deck, some of the cards have other symbols on them, such as a bow, a sword, a kettle, etc. These symbols are used in the "Action Game", which is a mix of Fluxx and Uno.

The "Mega Memo Game" uses both the large and small cards. The large cards are placed in the middle of the table with the main picture side up. The smaller cards are all dealt out to the players. The top large card is turned over revealing the character portrait and perhaps a number and/or symbol. The players race to see who can match these revealed items with pictures and/or symbols and/or numbers using the smaller cards in their hands. The first to do so claims the large card. The player with the most large cards wins.

The large cards can also be turned over and put together puzzle-fashion to make a group shot of the main characters from the movie.

And finally, the smaller cards can be used to play any regular card game.

197734.name: Trancers (1st Edition)
197734.description:
From the introduction:

The game is set in the future, in the year 2360. The future has many new horizons of opportunity, but it also has more terror. The biggest terror in 2360 is an organization known as Trancers. Trancers are in the process of ridding the world of normal folks.

An elite fighting force, known as the Trancer Hunters, have arisen to destroy the threat the Trancers pose. The Trancer Hunters search out and destroy all Trancers that they find. Due to the help of the Trancer Hunters, most peoples' lives run normally, but for the Trancer Hunter, nothing is normal.

User summary:

The Trancers 1st edition was written ca. 1994 but not published until 2014. The "Pocket Edition" has the same contents, but has improved formatting, a different cover image, and has a different page size and layout.

197735.name: Trancers (2nd Edition)
197735.description:
From the introduction:

The Trancers Role Playing Game (TRPG) is based on the Trancers movies, a five-part series by Full Moon Entertainment starring Tim Thomerson as Jack Deth. The first Trancers (aka Future Cop) was released in 1985 and is markedly better than the direct-to-video sequels. If you haven't watched the movie, this game might not be as fun so we recommend watching it or re-watching it before playing. But if you want a quick recap, here you go.

Jack Deth is a tough-as-nails-cop in 2247. He's matched against Martin Whistler, a physic criminal mastermind who can convert people into zombie followers with the mere power of his mind. To escape Deth, Whistler travels back in time to the 1980's to assassinate the ancestors of the Council Members who oppose him. Jack must travel back, into the body of an ancestor, to save the Council of Angel City. He must keep his girlfriend (played by a punk rock Helen Hunt) and learn to live in 80's California while tracking down Whistler and ending his menace once and for all.published until 2014.

197736.name: Trancers Character Sheet
197736.description:
User summary:

This one-page PDF document presents a character sheet suitable for use with either the 1st or 2nd edition of the Trancers role-playing game. It is intended for print-and-play use.

197737.name: Orpheus
197737.description:
From the introduction:

Orpheus is a different dimension where magic works and everyone rides horses and uses swords. In fact, it is a lot like the medieval Earth—only Orpheus is ruled by evil Trancer Lords! Worse yet, these Trancers are also vampires and will suck your life out if you are not careful. Most people do not try to mess with the Trancer Lords because they do not want to have their life forces sucked out. However, there are some brave people who will fight them: the Rebel Resistance.

197738.name: Trancers at the Earth's Core
197738.description:
From the introduction:

Pellucidar is a land 500 miles below the surface of the earth. A miniature sun suspended at the center of the hollow sphere always shines; there is no night on Pellucidar. The miniature sun never changes in brightness, and never sets; so with no night or seasonal progression, the natives have little concept of time. The world is additionally more vast than our own. Our oceans and their continents and, correspondingly, our continents are their oceans. Time is elastic, and months for one person can seem like a few hours for another. Because time flows so differently at the Earth's Core, long-second watches no longer function. And because of the permanent noon-high sun, and because of the unnatural lack of a horizon, all PC's lost 1d4 Agility and Endurance for 1d4 days upon first reaching Pellucidar.

197739.name: Métal Hurlant
197739.description:
From the introduction:

The story of Heavy Metal is the story of the Lochnar. While it appears as an innocuous, oversized glowing green marble, it is in fact far worse.
...
The sentient Lochnar has powers unimaginable. It can melt the flesh off a person almost instantaneously, though it at times chooses not to as well. (When the Professor's daughter showed it to Harry, neither were hurt by it.) It can also transport people to other planets, other dimensions, and completely change bodies' age, sex, size, and color and sometimes personality. It can speak, can restrain movement, can fly of its own volition and is capable of reanimating the dead (creating zombies.) Above all, the Lochnar prefers to corrupt through greed and love of power.
...
Like all villains, its overconfidence is its weakness. The Lochnar has a propensity for gloating, especially in the presence of its enemies the Terrakian. Once a thriving race, now there is only ever one Terrakian, and she is always female.

197740.name: A Game of Deth
197740.description:
From the introduction:

In the year 2360, a mysterious Trancer Boss has figured out a new way to trance squids: through a game called Hero Dungeon. The Trancer Boss has his Trancer gang bring in squids from all over Angel City to play in Hero Dungeon tournaments, with a promise of big cash payouts to the winner. However, there are no winners because everyone who plays either gets tranced or singed!

The Council has found out about this new threat and has decided to send in some undercover Trancer Hunters to infiltrate the tournament. Can they stop the Trancer Boss in time, or will they get tranced along with all the others in this game of death?

197741.name: 'Til Deth Do Us Part
197741.description:
From the introduction:

Your exploits as a Trancer Hunter have gotten the attention of the Council and they call you in to send you on a special mission. They tell you that David Singer, the notorious Trancer Boss has gone down the line to 1995 in order to build a Trancer army and take out the Council’s ancestors.

They don’t have much information on where he is, except that it is likely somewhere in L.A. and he has taken over a mostly unknown ancestor named Jesse Singer.

You agree to take the job and they tell you that your ancestor, Daryl, was an almost identical match to you. In fact, he is so much like you that you will not have to roll any different stats.

After they send you down the line, they send you some boxes with the supplies that you will need: your weapons, two doses of time serum—one to send Singer back up the line and one for yourself—and a Ctrl-Z. The Ctrl-Z has one charge and will allow you to reroll any check or go back any one entry in the adventure and make a different choice.

197742.name: Trancers NPC Codex Volume 1
197742.description:
User summary:

This supplement contains nineteen details non-player characters for the Trancers game. Each character has a completed "stat block" and description, as well as a (rough) illustration.

The document does not contain any designer, artist, or other credits.

197743.name: 1985 (Trancers)
197743.description:
From the introduction:

While it is true that one of the greatest features of the Trancers RPG is the fact that you can literally play your characters in any time and on any different world, it is also a known fact that the best and most hyperrealistic game setting for any campaign is 1985 Los Angeles. This is the paradise that Martin Whistler chose to infect in the first Trancers film and which Jack Deth himself chose to spend the rest of his life—forsaking even the awesome clothing of the future!

rpg: Lesbo Jet Fighters: Dive Into the Sky
197744.name: Lesbo Jet Fighters: Dive Into the Sky (Old System)
197744.description:
From the game:

The standard setting for Dive into the Sky is assumed to be a sort of other-world, inhabited by the spirits of well-known and much-loved military hardware. It's organized into vague countries, and characters are presumably on one side or another in some form of large-scale war. As in Ace Combat, aircraft are not limited by country of origin, and MiGs will be seen happily fighting alongside American aircraft. The various nations are separated by ideological differences, and presumably locked in warfare.

The military of each side of this conflict is as strange as one might expect. Rather than simple weapons of war, vehicle and pilot are one and the same. They live on bases, in a vaguely military lifestyle, and spend their off time hanging around, visiting areas off-base if they have leave, or otherwise occupying their time as your particular gaming group sees fit.

rpg: Lesbo Jet Fighters: Dive Into the Sky
197745.name: Dive Into the Sky (New System)
197745.description:
User summary:

The "New System" version of the game resulted from play-testing of the "Old System" and converting the rules from the light-weight "storytelling" dice-pool system to a "crunchier" system using modified skill rolls compared to target difficulty values. In the "New System" (also sometimes called the "Superfun" System), combat is played in turns, with distance, movement, and various other options being a standard part of the game. Characters have multiple "status conditions" as well as simple damage.

While the game mechanics have been completely replaced, the setting and tone remain unchanged. The game's title was shortened, according to the wiki because it was felt to be somewhat misleading because characters generally are involved only in "grabbing your wingman's [breasts] and being ambiguously gay."

197746.name: Kairos
197746.description:
User summary:

This rules-light storytelling game uses structured turns with a type of narrative control that allows characters to jump into nearly any situation. A single character narrates every scene, though another character can interrupt the scene with their own scene. Upon completion of the interrupting scene, the interrupted scene resumes. The primary role of the game master is to coordinate and track all these interrupting scenes. The goal of the game is to create a series of distinct but related narrative arcs.

197747.name: Lorin Dracht
197747.description:
From the introduction:

The mad tinkerer and archaeologist of the Windswept Realms, Lorin Dracht is a bizarre figure that devoted his entire life to scouring the ruins of the Ancients and uncovering their secrets. Breakthroughs in his research led to his trademark clockwork technology as well as several other secret breakthroughs that he kept to himself.

197748.name: Garden Gnomes: Wizard Warfare
197748.description:
Garden Gnomes: Wizard Warfare is a modified rock-paper-scissors on steroids, with cute garden gnomes casting deadly spells at each other. You have to outguess your opponents and pick spells that counter the spells they have chosen.

Each players represents a tribe of garden gnomes, and each tribe is at war with its neighbors. During initial set-up, each player receives a special power card that determines which type of spells their tribe is skilled at casting; these can be any of the five types: flames, water, plants, insects or earth.

During each round of play, each player selects one of the five different spells to cast against each of their neighbors. (If only one opponent remains, you pick only one spell.) You cannot pick the same spell for each opponent. All spells are then simultaneously revealed, and a winner is determined on each of the battlefronts. (There is also a possibility of a draw, in which case none of the players win, and none of the players lose.) The winning player then deals one damage to the losing player's tribe, and +1 damage if they have the special power for the element they used to win (or +2 if they have two of the same special power).

Each player starts the game with ten tribe-members, and the last tribe alive wins.

197749.name: King of Pirates
197749.description:
King of Pirates is a game about pirates competing to be the first to plunder 10,000 doubloons in order to be crowned as the new king. Players hire crews and and attack towns to plunder their doubloons. Combat is resolved with dice-rolling, but players also have access to many different action cards that can influence the outcome of a battle by:


Giving yourself increased combat stats.
Giving a town attacked by your opponents better combat stats.
Disabling your opponents in some ways by decreasing how far they can sail, decrease their combat stats, making them skip a turn, etc.


Players can also gain doubloons by digging up buried treasure, or by attacking each other.

197752.name: Shakes and Fidget
197752.description:
Create your own hero and delve into a dangerous world full of Monster Rabbits and Brides from Hell! Complete exciting adventures or take down other players in the arena! Collect experience, win gold, acquire honor, and found your own guild with friends!

Features

Free to play
Already over 20 million players worldwide
Unique comic-book look




Source: The Game Website.

197753.description:
The second Promo Pack of 27th Passenger: A Hunt on Rails consists of a set of three new event cards.

The new event cards are:
True Colors (green)
Into Thin Air (yellow)
Open Book (red)
197753.name: 27th Passenger: A Hunt on Rails – True Colors Promo Pack

197754.description:
The third Promo Pack of 27th Passenger: A Hunt on Rails consists of a set of three new event cards.
Apart from two new cards for the green and the yellow parts of the route, you can find here a new Finale Event Card, which offers an alternative game end full of suspense.

The new event cards are:
Chatty Bunch (green)
Even Flow (yellow)
No Biggie (red FINALE)
197754.name: 27th Passenger: A Hunt on Rails – Chatty Bunch Promo Pack

197755.name: Mallavray's Magnificent Manual of Magical Marvels
197755.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this book the arch-wizard Mallavray indexes 50 of his favourite magical items, artifacts, and even a couple spells that any wise adventurer would do well to keep their eye out for! Far from a book full of boring flaming swords, this manual has selected to present many exotic and unorthodox treasures enchanted by the most unusual sources!

50 Painstakingly analyzed magical items with not only rich and flavourful descriptions and histories but also divinely inspired technical balance.
16 amusing illustrations of some of the best treasures to tantalize those adventurers brave enough to seek them out.




Written foreward and asides from Mallavray himself.
Suitable for any Pathfinder scenario or campaign, these items can add enormous flavour tactical options as well as many opportunities to come up with side adventures involving these items.

197756.name: The Inexorant (Base Class)
197756.description:
From publisher blurb:

The ability to mix magic with martial prowess is not solely the province of the magus. The Inexorant presents a martial character class wholly on par with the fighter in regards to combat skills yet capable of wielding eldritch energies generated from his own inner reserve.

197757.name: Silver Bluff
197757.description:
From publisher blurb:

Silver Bluff provides respite from the nearby harsh mountains. Chief among these is Mount Argent, which the villagers mine for its namesake silver on behalf of the Hargrave’s Resources mining company. However, the respite is anything but welcome, as the miners distrust each other as much as they do strangers. The rich silver seams the miners have worked for over fifty years have dried up. While the recent discovery of powdered adamantine temporarily buoyed hopes among the villagers, a grisly murder has put everyone on edge.

197758.name: Cro-Magnum
197758.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Caveman on a Quest for Firearms… Cro-Magnum!

A Power Level 10 Rogue, Cro-Magnum is a time-traveling thug with a lust for firepower. Cro-Magnum is an iconic character in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Cro-Magnum’s file is designated "Blue" to indicate the apparent technological origins for his powers. If his wildly suspect claims are to be believed, he is a time-traveling caveman with a unique affection for firearms. Whether this is true or not, one thing is certain: Cro-Magnum is big, tough, brutish, and always armed to the teeth with guns. Rifles, pistols, machineguns, flintlocks… All. The. Guns. Any hero who hates firearms or the danger they represent is going to find Cro-Magnum a perfect nemesis. He’s also a pain for any hero seeking to protect the citizens of their city from a criminal who instigates firefights just to test out his latest “toys.”

197759.description:
Deadbolt is an expansion pack for the Vaults card game. With Deadbolt 2 – 6 players compete to become the richest Crime Lord. On their journey to the top they recruit professional safe crackers with various abilities and skills.
Every good crew needs their specialized tools. But if things go wrong, it is always smart to have a getaway car nearby.

New vault cards offer many exciting options. Sometimes it is wise to leave the loot in the Vault and use classified information to further your cause.

With Deadbolt you are guaranteed more combos, more tactics and more fun!
197759.name: Vaults: Deadbolt

197760.description:
Geistesblitz: Spooky Doo is the latest addition to Zoch’s brain twister family of games. It comes in a beautiful metal box and features two new items, the barrel and the fez. While the basic Geistesblitz rules still apply, the fez can be placed over any of the other items. It is a new challenge to know which item is hidden underneath the fez at all times.

Balduin, the house ghost, found an old camera in the castle cellar. Immediately he photographed everything that he loves to make disappear when he is haunting  – including himself, of course. Unfortunately, the enchanted camera takes many photos in the wrong colors. Sometimes the green bottle is white, at other times it's blue. Looking at the photos, Balduin doesn't really remember any more what he wanted to make disappear next. Can you help him with his haunting and quickly name the right item, or even make it disappear by yourself? If you grab the right items quickly, you have a good chance of winning...

The lightning fast shape and color recognition game that is sure to test the reflexes of kids, families and gamers alike. In Duuuszki: Edycja limitowana, five items sit on the table waiting to be caught. Each card in the deck shows pictures of two objects, with one or both objects colored the wrong way. With all players playing at the same time, someone reveals a card, then players grab for the "right" object – but which object is right?

If one object is colored correctly – say, a green bottle and a red mouse – then players need to grab that correctly colored object.
If both objects are colored incorrectly – say, a green ghost and a red mouse – then you look for the object and color not represented among the four details shown. In this case you see green, red, ghost and mouse, so players need to grab the blue barrel.
The first player to grab the correct object keeps the card, then reveals the next card from the deck. If a player grabs the wrong object, she must discard one card previously collected. Once the card deck runs out, the game ends and whoever has collected the most cards wins!

The new key feature is now the fez. Fez is used to cover one of the other elements. When the players are obliged the catch the fez they instead say the name of an item under the fez. When the players are obliged the catch the item under the fez, they instead catch the fez to show the item that was covered. Whenever fez is caught the player holding it may cover the same or new item.
197760.name: Ghost Blitz: Spooky Doo
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ139: Fantasma Blitz: Quin ensurt! (2016) Jacques Zeimet

197761.name: What Do You Buy?
197761.description:
The game What Do You Buy? consists of a series of cards representing tradesmen, each of which has an associated number of items for sale. The trades cards and items are distributed to the players. A narrator reads aloud a story contained in the rules booklet, and at each blank in the story looks at one of the players, who then turns over the top item in their stack and reads it aloud. It is a party game intended to provoke merriment.

The original version was published c. 1850 in London by J. Passmore as The Laughable Game of What D'Ye Buy? by Professor Punch, and featured 12 finely hand-colored engraved trades cards, 72 letterpress cards, and a 20-page booklet, all contained in a wooden box with an illustrated sliding lid.

Later versions were published by McLoughlin Brothers c. 1870 and in an "improved" version in the early 1900s. McLoughlin also published a simpler variant, What Do You Buy? with only eight trades — butcher, druggist, music store, furniture, fish market, bakery, dry goods and toy store — each with five items available. For example:

16: "Wishing to have something new to wear at a dinner party Susette was to give, I tried on AN ACCORDIOON.
17. Susette laughed, and said it fitted like A LUMP OF DOUGH.
18. So instead I bought FIVE POUNDS OF TRIPE.

197763.description:
From the publisher:

For the first time ever, play as Slimer as he fights against Jack Higgins and his skeleton crew in this campaign containing 4 scenarios, 4 new map tiles, 9 new minis, and more tokens! Slimer is the first playable Ghost character in Ghostbusters: The Board Game II and has new interesting skill sets that come from his vaporous state of being. Slimer gets abilities that allow him to move in ways no other Ghostbuster can. He’s handy with a Slime Blower or Proton Pack, and other Ghosts might not see him as an immediate threat.

Trick shots and sneak attacks are a pirate’s specialty, and with the Gold Doubloon token, you can make shots with your weapon that weren’t possible before.
197763.name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game II – Slimer's Sea Fright

197764.description:
Play as Louis Tully (ear muffs and all) in this campaign containing 4 scenarios, 4 new map tiles, 9 new minis, and more tokens! This campaign culminates in a battle against the dreaded Giga-Plazm, which has taken the Manhattan Museum of Art from its foundation.

Tully gets better at being a Ghostbuster when he can watch others do well at Ghostbusting. He’s also very good at making the most out of his deposits. If you’re tired of running, you can hop onto one of the new vehicle tokens included in this pack.
197764.name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game II – Louis Tully's Plazm Phenomenon

197765.name: Angels & Vixens
197765.description:
From the introduction:

Female wrestling today has grown to be almost as popular as the male version, one could never had predicted that it would have attained this level. Initially female wrestling began as a sideshow attraction to the main male wrestling show.

197766.name: Gunnheim
197766.description:
The Lord of Death hits the bottle hard on the Ragnarok of all benders and hell breaks loose- literally. Enter the unholy children of Gunnheim: gun-toting, skull-crushing Viking warriors born and bred for battle, summoned to restore the balance. Gunnheim is a 1-4 player top down shooter inspired by Viking mythology and the golden era of couch co-op gaming.

In Gunnheim, you’re bringing the term berserker to a whole new level, saving the day by dishing out carnage of hellish proportions. Armed to the teeth with all manner of modern weaponry, fight your way through hordes of hellspawn with your brothers and sisters at your side, survive epic boss fights against the biggest and baddest of the devil’s children, and watch with maniacal glee as your enemies are turned to bloody piles of pulp, fangs and horns. Put your goggles on, it’s about to get really, really messy.

Source: The Developer Website.

197767.name: Bazaar of the Bizarre: Archer's Best Friend
197767.description:
Magical Bows and Ammunition

From the introduction:

A collection of magic bows and ammunition from converted to 5e rules from Dragon Magazine. Each article a collection of reader submissions. Credit to the original authors is given with each item.

197768.name: Bazaar of the Bizarre: Rings that Do Weird Things
197768.description:
Twenty-one magical rings

From the introduction:

A collection of magic rings from two articles in Dragon Magazine. Rings that Do Weird Things in #82, and Bazaar of the Bizarre in #117. Each article a collection of reader submissions. Credit to the original authors is given with each item.

197773.name: Airs of Ages Past
197773.description:
Nine magical harps from the Forgotten Realms

From the introduction:

From an article originally appearing in Dragon Magazine #115, by Ed Greenwood.

User summary:

Revised and updated for the 5th Edition.

197774.name: By Magic Masked
197774.description:
Nine magical masks from the Forgotten Realms

From the introduction:

From an article originally appearing in Dragon Magazine #117, by Ed Greenwood.

User summary:

Revised and updated for the 5th Edition.

197775.name: Grognard's Grimoire: Sorcerers
197775.description:
Options for Sorcerers

From the introduction:

A variant of the spell point rules for sorcerers, six new metamagic options, two spells, and a sorcerous bloodline: the Incantatrix based on both the 3rd Edition prestige class and the NPC class from Dragon Magazine #90 by Ed Greenwood.

User summary:

Revised and updated for the 5th Edition.

197777.name: Parque Polvoranca: Jardín de Rocas
197777.description:
Parque Polvoranca: Jardín de Rocas is a board game for two to five players in which, we control preschool students during a sunny day excursion and try to help them for learn as much as possible about geology.

At the start of the game, every player receives secret mission cards and 20 cards with numbers between "3" and "5" of the same five colours than student groups. Use your cards for move the kids finding the objectives of your secret mission cards and collect combination of cards for take more points than the other players, and the end of the game player with more victory points is the better student of geology (and of course, the winner).


"Parque Polvoranca: Jardín de Rocas" es un juego de mesa para dos a cinco jugadores en el que, controlamos los estudiantes de preescolar durante una excursión de un día soleado y tratar de ayudarlos a aprender tanto como sea posible acerca de la geología.

Al comienzo del juego, cada jugador recibe cartas de misión secreta y 20 otras con números comprendidos entre "3" y "5" de los mismos cinco colores que los grupos de estudiantes. Utiliza tus 20 cartas para mover a los niños y cumplir los objetivos de sus cartas de misión así como recoger combinaciones de cartas para tener más puntos que los otros jugadores, al final del jugador del juego con más puntos de victoria es el mejor estudiante de la geología (y, por supuesto, el ganador).

197779.name: Firefly: The Game – Fruity Oaty Bar
197779.description:
The Firefly Cargo Crate is a mystery subscription service by Loot Crate, delivering a collection of official Firefly collectibles every 2 months. The Fruity Oaty Bar was part of one of those crates. It reads:

Discard before rolling to add +1 to any test result.
- OR -
Discard to remove Disgruntled from the owner.

197780.name: Smiley Games
197780.description:
Smiley Games uses six different smiley cards (happy, angry, wink, sad, surprised, in love) in six different colors (orange, blue, yellow, green, violet, red) — along with special dice — for five different games that stimulate memory, reflexes and visual perception, while also requiring strategy, observation and concentration.

GAME 1: Find it! Be the first player to reach the target number of cards by pointing the right card the fastest.

GAME 2: That's mine! Win the highest number of cards by putting your hand first on a matching card.

GAME 3: Shout! Win the highest number of cards by shouting the name of the player who has a card matching an element of your own card.

GAME 4: Domino. Be the first player to run out of cards by playing a variant of the game Domino.

GAME 5: The last one! Be the first player to run out of cards by discarding matching color or facial expression smileys.

Play and smile!

197782.name: *weid-
197782.description:
User summary:

This ingenious game is for exactly four players. The game is played in four defined phases, with different actions taken in each phase. Players use a variety of tokens and paper slips. The paper slips have a glyph written on them, and it's meaning is defined, augmented, altered, re-written during play. The game concludes with a series of defined glyphs as a play artifact.

This game was the Italian-language winner of Game Chef 2014.

197783.name: Get Rich Quick
197783.description:
Risk it all by investing in penny stocks, launch the talk of Silicon Valley start-up, or go to work to secure your next paycheck — these are some of the choices you have to make in Get Rich Quick to attain the fortune points (25 points total for the win) associated with doing nothing, anywhere, anytime! Regretfully, the players around you are at work to ensure they get there first, forcing you to use tactics they do not teach at school to outsmart them in this race to reach the illusive nirvana.

On each turn, all players select three action cards from their hand and place them face down in front of them. Once the players have selected their cards, they simultaneously flip their three cards face up, then the action cards are resolved according to their value from 1-7. Once all actions are resolved, players take back their action cards and a new turn begins.

One of the action cards (the shopping card) allows players to spend money to buy special upgrades on the Summit Shopping Center board to help them achieving their goal. Those upgrades are available in limited quantities and can help you win in multiple ways.

If one or more players accumulate or surpass 25 fortune points at the end of a turn, the game ends. In case of a tie, the players with the most money wins.

197784.name: O Jogo de Cartas do Amor
rpg: O Jogo de Cartas do Amor
197784.description:
User summary:

This peculiar game combines several concepts of traditional live-action role-playing games with a non-collectible card game, using a custom deck. The cards are played one at a time, and in fact may be created during play as part of the game activity. Live-action play involves exchanging cards and, hopefully, enlisting new players into the game.

User summary:

This game was the Portuguese-language winner of Game Chef 2014.

197785.name: Word-O-Rama
197785.description:
Word-O-Rama is a quiz or knowledge game for 3 or more players. Each player receives a pencil and a large pad printed with a 5x5 square. Like a bingo card, it has a "free" square in the middle, but there are spaces to the left for a vertical five-letter keyword, on top for 5 categories, and on the right for scoring.

The game box contains a spinner that goes from 1 to 75. To begin a game, the players make five spins to determine categories for the game. They spin one more time to determine the key word for the game. The rules include a table of 75 categories and 75 keywords.

The players then start a 10-minute hourglass-style timer. Within that time limit, they try to write down for each category an answer that begins with the corresponding letter of the keyword. The rules show as an example a game with the category "animals" in the first column and the keyword CARDS: correct answers could include "camel" on the first (C) line and "dog" on the fourth (D) line.

Players get 10 points for each valid answer, but only if it is unique. If two players pick the same word, they get 5 points each, and if three or more think alike, no one gets any points. Players get a bonus of 10 points for each fully completed vertical, horizontal or diagonal line on the card.

197786.name: Say My Name
197786.description:
Say My Name mixes Celebrities with new mechanics like taboo words or a lighting round where you find coincidences.

From the game box (in Spanish):

En SAY MY NAME tenés que darle pistas a tus compañeros de equipo para que adivinen el contenido de la tarjeta lo más rápido posible. Antes de empezar elegí la categoría que más te guste: Títulos, Personajes o Vale Todo.

La partida se divide en 4 rondas.

RONDA 1: podés hablar, actuar, hacer sonidos, señalar, etc. Pero no podés mencionar el título o personaje a adivinar ni tampoco la Palabra Clave.
Apurate, solo tenés 30 segundos para lograr que tus compañeros adivinen la mayor cantidad de tarjetas posibles.

RONDA 2: es igual a la Ronda 1 pero solo podés decir una palabra y actuar.

RONDA RELÁMPAGO: en esta ronda todos los equipos compiten a la vez por ver quién es el primero en adivinar la Palabra Clave.

RONDA 3: en esta ronda solo podés actuar.

197788.name: Final Boss: The card game
197788.description:
In Final Boss, players compete against each other to be the one who defeats the Final Boss. Kill monsters to collect power-ups and destroy your competitors!

Final Boss features 2 basic decks: Enemies and Drops with hilarious video game references and frenzy "take that" mechanics.

Each turn, players draw drops to power up themselves, and send enemies against the other players.
When in combat, players will play their drop cards to win their combat. BUT WAIT! The other players can interfere in the battle to try to force their rival's death, so be very careful on which cards you play or you'll end up dead.

Oh, and do not forget: a Final Boss can appear and turn the tides of a game at any moment!

197790.name: Vinyl
boardgamepodcastepisode: What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 73
197790.description:
From the designer:

"Vinyl is the real deal" - Jack White

As fledgling vinyl collectors, players are hunting down albums for their collection. Players come to record stores armed with their parents' old records, ready to acquire just the right albums to add to a collection they've already started or start a new one.

Albums are represented by square cards, each having album art and icons representing its attributes (genre, decade, limited release, mint condition, and value). These cards are placed in a grid which scales with the number of players. On a players turn, they move their token around a vinyl rondel track to collect albums, move to new stores, get more dollar-bin albums to trade with later, and more.

Compete with your opponents as you hunt down cards that share attributes for different collections (in the form of cards), and make it harder for them to attain a grail album by reserving it first.

"The thrill of the hunt that culminates with a celebration of the catch." - Matt Mikas (Vinyl Collector)

197791.name: The Wheel
197791.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is an oldfashioned design with a spun torus to simulate gravity.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

197792.name: The Lost Temple of Forgotten Evil (5E/1E)
197792.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Fith Edition Fantasy and OSR adventure for 4-6 player of level 4-6

The small town of Boldon, and its surrounding villages are afraid. Dozens of people are missing, some speculate lost to some nefarious purpose. A broken drunkard tells fantastic tales of an evil temple and the horrible things within. The rare few who know the legends and history of the region are beginning to think the dark times have returned; not seen since the fall of the first age of man. People are beginning to feel the icy fingers of fear closing in. The party becomes aware of these events, and is inspired to investigate. This leads them to a broken man who tells them a story of a lost temple. Has it been rediscovered by men seduced by its forgotten evil? The drunkard’s tale leads to others who might help the party discover more before they face The Lost Temple of Forgotten Evil.

197793.name: Duke Dedrakon (ICONS)
197793.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write up of Duke Dedrakon a terrible despot seeking his own demise. Cursed with immortality by a secretive order, the Duke will destroy any who cross his path. Includes full stats with tactical and plot suggestions.

197794.description:
A tabletop game for up to 4 players ages 8 and up. It is Halloween night and you have to get as many of your trick-or-treaters back home to safety while avoiding getting killed by the very real vampires who are out hunting in your neighborhood.

Each player has a set of pawns representing your trick-or-treaters and 3 dice that match color.

On your turn, take your dice and one die from an opponent of your choice. Roll them.

Rolling 1, 2, 3 means you can move your trick-or-treaters that number of spaces.

Rolling V1 or V2 allows you to move the vampires that number of spaces.

If the + side of the die is rolled, take a die from another player and roll it.

The opponent’s die is treated differently than the player’s own dice. 1, 2, 3 you move your opponent’s trick-or-treater that number of spaces. You cannot move the opponent’s t-o-t to the same space as a vampire.

If the V1 or V2 is rolled, your opponent gets to move a vampire. Vampires can only be moved once on your turn.

If the + is rolled it is treated the same as above.

WINNING

When all trick-or-treaters have been saved (made it to the center space) or killed by vampires, the game is over. The player with the most safe trick-or-treaters wins. Ties are possible.

It is also possible (though rare) that the vampires can win if no trick-or-traters make it to the center.
197794.name: Vampire Cul-de-sac

197796.name: The Last Stand of British Magic
197796.description:
from the designer

This is a solo RPG of survival, and perhaps victory, against overwhelming odds. It uses a standard tarot deck and keeping a written journal as its main features. It is adapted from the RPG Swords of the Skull-Takers v0.3 by Joe J. Prince and is thematically inspired by Susanna Clarke's book Jonathan Strange & Mr. Norrell.

The core of the game is unchanged, with only thematic adjustments and a rearranging of the rules.

197797.name: Apocalypse Hotel - The Post-Apocalyptic Hotel Simulator!
197797.description:
Can you run a successful hotel even though the world has ended? Repair, renovate, and decorate the ‘Apocalypse Hotel’ while fending off zombies, mutants and the alien Gogfang!

After the alien invasion: the Gogfang began terraforming Earth, pumping out toxic chemicals to transform it into the perfect trans-dimensional, methane paradise… the process should take fifty years.

In the meantime the strange blend of chemicals has begun to mutate the populace, turning some into hideous, fish-people, and reanimating the dead. So far you have been immune to these changes and have fought your way across the country back to your parents’ hotel, hoping they are still alive.

Whether they are or not, you have decided to make a go of it, to repair and renovate their unsightly, sixties-styled hotel into a community where people can be safe from the aliens, mutants, and zombies. Of course… they will have to pay you for the service.

Source: The Developer Website.

197798.description:
The Depths of Durangrar is a dungeon crawler table top game that is played in the dark. Individual explorers will light up to illuminate only what is in front of them in a 3D maze. The goal of the explorers is to find treasure in the maze and bring it out of the maze from where they came. However, explorers must be careful for a monster hunts them in the maze. The monster does not light up and remains hidden in the darkness. The monster player is wearing night vision goggles and can see the whole maze.

Players move throughout the maze using action points. Action points are spent moving space to space, rotating, picking up gold, using their unique abilities, using items and attacking other players. Explorers can also team up with one another to increase their odds of killing the monster, however, it leaves them open to betrayal where another explorer can steal the gold they have collected for their own gain.

The explorers are the Scout, Knight and Demolitionist. The Scout can have more action points than other explorers. The Knight can reduce damage they take in combat and the Demolitionist can permanently remove walls from the maze.

The monsters are the Thresher, Excavator and Sentient Fungus. The Thresher can jump over walls to ambush explorers. The excavator can build temporary walls to trap explorers and the Sentient Fungus can build environmental traps to injure and slow the advance of explorers.
197798.name: The Depths of Durangrar
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 018 – Star Wars: Rebellion vs Star Wars: Imperial Assault

197799.name: Nebula (2014)
197799.description:
User summary:

In this game, three or four players take turns playing, altering, erasing, or coupling words on the lay surface. Several rules govern what can and can't be done on one's turns, but the troupe attempts to form a winning narrative (a "constellation") through shared play.

The game is presented on a single "page" of very unusual size.

This game won the French-language Game Chef 2014 competition.

197800.name: Hot Dogs, Horseshoes & Hand Grenades
197800.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Do you like hot dogs? How about horseshoes? Hand grenades? (everyone likes hand grenades) Anyway, we got all that, and guns. So if you like cooking, lawn games, and ordnance, this is the VR sandbox game for you.

Source: The Game Website.

197801.name: Unseen Diplomacy
videogamehonor: 2017 British Academy Game Awards Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
197801.description:
Unseen Diplomacy casts you as an elite member of The British Espionage Tactical Initiative, defeating the plans of evil-doers around the world. With a real-life obstacle course using every inch of your room-scale space, created by Steam VR, you will run and roll & sneak your way through lairs.

Source: The Developer Website.

197802.name: Toy Plane Heroes
197802.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




The game is made for VR and you are going to experience an incredible feeling of scale, because you are a tiny toy figure.

197803.name: Modbox
videogamehonor: 2016 CVA Best Educational Game of the Year Winner
2016 CVA Best Game Innovation of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Best Technology of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Best Virtual Reality Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Proto Awards Best Overall Experience of the Year Nominee
2016 Proto Awards Best User Interface Winner
197803.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Modbox is a VR physics sandbox game for the HTC Vive. Create your own Holodeck experience to play in and share.

Source: The Developer Website.

197805.name: The Queer & Deadly Town of Sorrowset
197805.description:
(publisher blurb)

The Queer and Deadly Town of Sorrowset is a procedurally generated urban micro-setting. Although it is designed with The Black Hack in mind it can easily be used with any Fantasy RPG.

197806.name: Threshold (Issue 11 - Apr 2016) Thyatis and Alphatia
rpgissuearticle: 20 Years of History in the Sea of Dawn
An Atlas of the Isle of Dawn
Lost Civilizations of Thyatis and Alphatia
Once Upon a Time in Ar—Part Six
197806.description:
Thyatis and Alphatia

From the back cover:

Visit Thyatis and Alphatia!

Two great Empires which have shaped the history of Mystara as we know it. Thyatis and Alphatia, enemies since a thousand years, one the dominion of fighters, the other a house of wizards.

From an exclusive story by Bruce Heard set in Alphatia to the more ancient past of the empires, a conversion of the Elemental Evil storyline set in Esterhold, the foresters of Thyatis, the Alphatian alphabet, the Thyatian language, gazetteers of Carytion and Limn, and to the Isle of Dawn.

Threshold magazine brings you to the heart of the empires, to
contemplate their Dawn and to meditate about their future.
Sunset seems still quite far away, the empires have no
intention to submit, not to their enemy, not to passage of
time.

197807.name: Goody White's Book of Folk Magic
197807.description:
From the back cover

Words from a Witch

Goodwife Elizabeth White was a non nonsense witch born in the 17th century. Over the years she learned many spells, hexes, and rituals to deal with common concerns such as


Hair Loss
Hunting
Impotence
Infertility
Love
Pregnancy
Sickness
Warts


lacking an heir for her knowledge, she wrote it all down, creating Goody White's Book of Folk Magic. Now her legacy has been "translated" into game terms -- each of these 45 folk remedies is written in our own words, then presented as a spell and witch hex, as well as a ritual that any character can learn.

These spells are things that a hedge mage might learn, or a local wise woman, midwife, or superstitious farmer might use to make life a little easier. They add flavor to a campaign and some are things that even a famous adventurer would want to learn. Whether you allow your player characters to find an actual copy of Goody White's Book of Folk Magic or if you just use it as a source of new low-powered magic fro your campaign, these add flavor to a campaign and show that there is magic in the world beyond what happens in combat.

197808.name: In Sheep's Clothing
197808.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are unique and built with different rules than non-player characters. All characters have a Profession Attribute, with an associated dice (d4, d6, d8, or d12), depending upon how proficient they are at their profession. Characters, universally afflicted with a "Werewolf Curse", have four additional Attributes, all associated with a d4: Animal Wildness, Crescent Moon, Unearthly Shining, and Insatiable Devouring. Actions in the game are resolved by opposed die rolls; special rules govern critical success or critical failure.

The game usually is called, in English, In Sheep's Clothing, but it also has been published under the name Undermoon Path.

This game was the Russian-language winner of the Game Chef 2014 competition.

197809.name: Steampunked Time Machine: Expansion #2
197809.description:
This Expansion Pack adds 64 new cards to your Steampunked game including: new mad scientists, new quackery, new components, and new actions.

New Actions: Inside Information, Monopolize, Purloin

Inventor card: Tesla

197810.name: Luna (2014)
197810.description:
User summary:

This unique game is two pages and intended to be used as a print-and-play game. The game starts with the players following the instructions printed on the page, to cut, fold, and assemble a play cube. The various sides of the cube have further game instructions to follow, which guides the game.

This game was the Polish-language winner of the Game Chef 2014 competition.

197811.name: The Lost Souls
197811.description:
User Summary

What does it feel like to find yourself in hell?

197812.name: Draw Rider
197812.description:
Draw Rider - a classic racing game, made in 2D. Your goal is to get to the finish line within a certain time. In the game you will find a huge variety of levels, the passage of which will open various options for character customization.

Source: The Developer Website.

197813.name: A grande bagunça espacial - The big space mess
197813.description:
Hello everyone! Welcome to the craziest adventure of your lives! The fearless Waldisglédson will face creatures from space and find allies on his journey!

Source: The Developer Website.

197814.name: RAM BOE
197814.description:
You control a fluffy ram called Boe in his quest to free every soul trapped inside rune stones.

Source: The Developer Website.

197815.name: Proton Pulse
197815.description:
Get ready for Classic Arcade Brick-Breaking Action from a whole new perspective in Virtual Reality! The entity known as M.O.A.I. has attacked, and the fate of the world is in your hands! You have been chosen to compete in the most diabolical game of atomic paddleball ever to grace the 3rd dimension.

Source: The Game Website.

197816.name: Lamokrady
197816.description:
From the publisher:

Who you are? You're a breeder! Become a llamaherd of your llamas, alpacas and guanacos - choose animals by their common characteristics and herd the flocks to get the points! Beware of malicious ducks - they will gather to hinder you in achieving the goal. Use the help of benevolent Dalai Lamas and cunning llamarustlers - but beware! - Your opponents may try to use them against you!

The title Lamokrady is a neologism, which comes from Polish words "lama" (llama) and "kraść" (to steel). It's catchy and familiar because of the similarity to word "koniokrady" (horse thieves).

In the game players try to collect sets of llamas with common characteristics. Every llama features 4 characterstics and players want to play sets of 3 llamas with 1/2/3/4 common characterstic in order to gain 1/3/7/13 points. Other than llamas the deck of cards consist of disturbing ducks and helpful Dalai Lamas.

On a turn a player choose one of these actions:
1) Play and score set of 3 llamas (with optional help of Dalai Lama) and draw 3 cards
2) Play a set of 4 ducks and draw 4 cards
3) Draw two cards from the deck and propose two cards from hand to next player

If a player was proposed with cards from previous player, instead of doing a normal turn she must do the following:
4) Discard them at the beginning of her turn and perform a normal turn
5) Accept the cards and propose two cards from hand to next player (this will count as a turn)
6) Accuse the giver of proposing a duck
6a) If the accusation was right, the current player receives 2 points, draw two cards from giver's hand, give her back the cards proposed, may perform action 1) or 2) and propose two cards for next player.
6b) If the accusation was wrong, the giver receives two points, the cards proposed are discarded and the accuser loses her turn.

The game ends when the deck is depleted. The player who gathers most points is the winner.

197817.name: Monster Pageant
197817.description:
Create monsters to enter into a monster pageant. The pageant judges are all looking for different things so make sure you prepare for judging as best you can!

The game is played using a school-yard pick where you create monsters by selecting cards that combine the different parts of a monster. Choose the legs & tails / torsos & arms / head combination that you think will "wow" the judges.

But just like every pageant, you can try to play foul to get ahead. Players have chances to "cheat" and gain an advantage over their competition. Strategy and tactics come into play as you choose the right time and place for your devious deeds.

Players choose from a shared supply where 5 of each type of monster body part is available. As cards are selected they are removed from the supply. Once removed cards form a gap of 2 or more, these gaps are refilled from the respective decks of body parts. Players select enough cards to each put forward 3 contestants into the pageant, one for each of the three judging rounds. Each monster will have an overall value made up from the traits represented on each body part, for example: hairy legs (value 2) + spikey torso (value 3), and a head that’s a little slimy (value 1) and a little hairy (value 1). Judges will give merit points to each monster based on their bias, and each judge is only interested in one trait. The first judging round is scored by one judge, two judges score the second round, and three judges score the third and final round.

The best monster in each judging round earns a player 3 points, with runners-up taking 2 points, good-looking losers earning 1 point, and everyone else 0 points!

Each player starts the game with 3 cheat tokens. These tokens can be spent during the pick phase to either: A) choose three cards on your turn instead of one, B) clear an entire row of cards, draw five more and then pick one, C) or take a peek at one of the judging cards to get information about what criteria will earns points during judging.

Any cheat tokens not spent during the picking phase are kept to the end of the game and earn the player an additional point towards their final score.

The player with the highest score at the end of the three judging rounds is the winner!

197818.name: Con-Quest
videogameversion: English / European Amstrad CPC Cassette edition
English / European ZX Spectrum Cassette edition
197818.description:
From the inlay:

A fully animated 3-D icon driven, graphic adventure in which Oscar, upon moving in to his newly acquired castle soon discovers that he is not alone - the castle is already inhabited by the Demon Grell and his minions. Therefore, if Oscar is to save his soul from the torment of walking through the fires of Hell for eternity he must evict his unwelcome guests.

Credits:

The original game was by Derek Brewster. It was converted to the Commodore 64 by Tranz-Form.

197819.name: Fury (Supers!)
197819.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I'll never be caged again." The driving motivation behind the savage, Fury. How do your heroes deal with a menace that is as much victim as villain?

197820.name: The Mahaha
197820.description:
From publisher blurb:

Within this installment’s pages you will find the true and terrible description of the mahaha – a shaggy, mountain-dwelling creature not dissimilar to a yeti or sasquatch, and yet far more unnerving than either… for the mahaha leaves its victims with a macabre calling card: a signature smile, twisted and frozen upon the faces of those unfortunate enough to succumb to the monster’s claws. Called by names like “the tickler,” or “the smiling man,” few creatures make for more unsettling foes. Derived from real-world Inuit myth, these terrors of the tundra are presented within these pages in the spirit of the original aboriginal legends. Read on, but take care, lest you crack a smile or let slip a chuckle. You wouldn’t want to do that…

197821.name: Shields
197821.description:
From publisher blurb:

Call to Arms is a book line for players and gamemasters alike. Each book focuses on a different type of item, expanding rules for those items and adding everything from new mundane and magical examples of the item to new character options related to the item. Call to Arms: Shields includes a look at the history and construction of shields, an alternative system for using shields, a large selection of new shields, special materials that can be applied to shields, how to use multiple materials with shields, and magic, cursed, mythic, and artifact shields both new and old.

rpgitemversion: Expanded Options #04: Weapons of Quality - Special Mundane Weapon Qualities PDF
Sidebar #04: Items of Quality - Weapons PDF
197822.name: Weapons of Quality - Special Mundane Weapon Qualities
197822.description:
From publisher blurb:

Call to Arms is a book line for players and gamemasters alike. Each book focuses on a different type of item, expanding rules for those items and adding everything from new mundane and magical examples of the item to new character options related to the item. Call to Arms: Shields includes a look at the history and construction of shields, an alternative system for using shields, a large selection of new shields, special materials that can be applied to shields, how to use multiple materials with shields, and magic, cursed, mythic, and artifact shields both new and old.

197823.name: Age of Races 1
197823.description:
From publisher blurb:

A New Age for These Races

Go beyond the standard fantasy races and play a new breed of hero! These intrepid adventurers forge their place in legends with claw, fin, spell, and sword. Now you can play one of these heroic races in your home game and battle monsters like never before.

Book of Heroic Races: Age of Races 1 introduces a number of playable races for your 13th Age Compatible game. This 15-page supplement gives you everything you need to include the following races at your table:

Catfolk, who can reroll an attack or save once per battle
Hagborn, who can reroll an attack or save once per battle
Lizardfolk, which bite and tear their enemies to shreds
Merfolk, who can sing a siren’s song to doom their enemies
Samsarans, that can draw on their past lives to aid them in battle




Be Heroic With These New Races Today!

197824.name: Elven Explorers
197824.description:
From publisher blurb:

Five young elves have set out to explore your 5th Edition campaign world. Each has their own unique subrace and bac kground, but all are curious adventurers. These can be used as heroes, adversaries, henchmen, or simply colorful chara cters. Add some elven spice to your 5th Edition game.

197825.name: Charader
197825.description: Charader is a word guessing game, a variant of the classic Charades. The game contains of 50 cards. Each card has 5 words on them, and one "performance" objective that must be fulfilled. The players are divided into two teams. One person in a team reads a card, and must get the other persons in the team to guess all the words on the card, without saying a word, just be doing gestures, and must also fulfll "performance" objective, eg. once during the charade correct their clothes, to get one point for the team. The charade must be done in a specific amount of time. Then it is the other teams turn. The team with most point in the end of the game, eg 10 rounds, is the winner.

197826.name: Familjecharader
197826.description:
Familjecharader is a word guessing game, a variant of the classic Charades. This is a family variant of the game with cards with pictures on them.

The game contains of 100 cards. Each card has 1 picture on them, eg a shark, a pencil or a rocking horse. The players are divided into two teams. One person in a team looks at one card, and must get the other persons in the team to guess what was depicted on the card with gestures, to get one point for the team. To do sounds (not words) is ok. The charade must be done in a specific amount of time. Then it is the other teams turn. The team with most point in the end of the game, eg 10 rounds, is the winner.

197827.name: Morf
197827.description: Morf is a type of charades but with drawing on paper instead of acting. The players draws, in turns, two cards, and must paint the two words on the cards, for example a camel and an umbrella. The other players must then come up with a name for what's pictured, for example "cambrella". The player that comes up with a word connected with the two "items" on the cards, get one point and move his/her pawn on the scoreboard. The player first to the center of the scoreboard (=19 points) in the winner.

197828.description:
2315 – It's 200 years since the Global Nuclear War and the following nuclear winter on planet Earth. The New Earth League, headed by the new super-power, the Xian, has ordered exploration of Alpha Centauri, with the prime mission to discover habitable planets and new forms of energy. Currently, the energy for propulsion, plasma from Helium-3 fusion, maxes out space ship thrusters at one-tenth the speed of light.

After mining Helium-3 on Mars and the Moon, it has taken over 50 years and three space bases to traverse the 40 trillion kilometres to reach AC. The pioneers spend their days charting and mining the planets and moons of the 3-star system.

On a routine mining trip to super-hot planet, Sir Isaac Newton, a new type of lava is discovered. Rumours soon spread throughout the factions of a new volatile fuel for propulsion. Admirals are alerted, suspicions are raised and treaties are broken.

Five competing factions: the Freelanders, New Brittany, the Nairobi, the Xian (Sian) and the Mozzies vie for control of the newly discovered resource. It's unstable properties could be harnessed to allow mankind to finally reach it’s long-sought-after goal – to travel at the speed of light!

You are the captain of your faction. Lead your sky-bots and miners into the fray against cunning adversaries in a winner-take-all, pell-mell battle. Will your people share in the staggering discovery, and glory – or be left far, far behind.

METTLE, is a 2-player space combat game, played with fantastic miniatures on 124 two inch tiles. Your goal is to fight past enemy bots, including a cloaked one, knock out laser towers and destroy the opposition fortress. Along the way you must collect lava-X and titanium which can be traded for reinforcements.

METTLE is a fast-paced game where both players are immersed in the action at all times.
197828.name: METTLE

197829.name: Prometheus's Night
197829.description:
From the game document:

Now, you hear the final sound of the night.

Victors, speak of the next world where your values have persevered.

Speak how that world will differ from the civilization that has departed.

Will that world not embrace this final night?

User summary:

This unusual game typically is distributed as a ZIP archive containing these three items:


Preface (2-page PDF document with introductory comments)
Transcript (12-page PDF game document)
Good Night (48.5 minute MP3 ambient game sound file)


This game was the winner of the Korean-language Game Chef 2014 competition.

197830.name: Förfestspelet
197830.description: Förfestspelet is a party game. The players roll the die in turn order. If the players pawn lands on a colored square (white, red or black) they draw a card in that color, the three different kind of cards in categories: "Sex", "Get to know each other" and "missions". The player that draw the card then have to say or do different thing, for example "Play your favorite music" or "show the others a secret SMS". The player that first get his/her pawn to the goal is the winner.

197831.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Dark Souls board game is a brutally hard exploration miniatures game for 1-4 players. Prepare to die.

The game features a "fast set-up, long reveal" mechanism that gets you into the game quickly and builds the location as you explore. The sense of danger is palpable as you discover new locations and the monsters that inhabit these dark places. The core combat mechanism and enemy behavior system forces deep strategic play and clever management of stamina to survive.

Dark Souls includes numerous boss and mini-boss encounters — including one against the Dragon Slayer Ornstein and Executioner Smough — and utilizes an innovative behavior mechanism so that no two encounters are ever the same, thus giving the game near infinite replayability.
197831.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game

9. Devon Dice Podcast - The Gallerist Review  and more

197832.name: The Contact
197832.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




A roleplay game with freedom of choice, police wanted System, criminal activities, home invasions, stealing, open world and a thrilling story.. with no need to follow!

Source: The Developer Website.

197833.name: Quar: Battle for Gate 18
197833.description:
Quar: Battle for Gate is a turn-based strategic VR game set in the grimsical world of Alwyd. The Quar are cute alien ant-eaters. Don't mistake cute for gentle. They use their WW1 level technology to wage war across the face of their world.

Source: The Developer Website.

197834.name: Portal Stories: VR
197834.description:
User Summary

Portal Stories: VR builds on the foundations of Portal Stories: Mel. Portal Stories: VR has a brand new mini story set in the Portal Universe. It features 10 brand new puzzles, specifically designed to work using the 360 degrees room scale that SteamVR offers.

197835.name: XLR
197835.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




In XLR you will compete against other pioneers as you set out to a hostile world to mine as many resources as you can before you are overrun by insect-like mechanical aliens.

Source: The Game Website.

197836.name: Steampunk Crescendo (Game Chef 2009)
197836.description:
From the introduction:

Steampunk Crescendo is a roleplaying game in a world gone wrong. Players will portray characters that wield supernatural powers with little or no constraint. And still it will not be enough to keep back the darkness...

Your character is the descendant of one of the Magi who saved the world. Your character must find their way through life, while living under a bloody shadow. What path will you choose? Your character faces a strict code of conduct and internal turmoil.

User summary:

This initial version of Steampunk Crescendo was submitted to the Game Chef 2009 competition. While this version is playable, the commercial version of the product is superior in presentation, formatting, refinement, and mechanics.

197837.name: Mutiny on the Seabird
197837.description:
User summary:

Two versions of this rules-light game were published; the original Game Chef 2009 entry and, based on early feedback, a revised version. Play in both versions is similar. One player is identified as the pirate captain. Though special in some respects, this player is not like a game master. Play proceeds with players taking turns trying to sway the remaining crew to mutiny (or, in the case of the captain, to non-mutiny). Dice rolls and tokens determine and track the relative influence of the various players.

197838.name: DemocraSea
197838.description:
A game of parrrlimentary procedure on the high seas!

After a mutiny, pirates aboard the good ship Due Process have struck on a more egalitarian way to divvy up treasure. Without a captain, players rely on their wits, political savvy, and a talking parrot to collect the most loot before the end of the voyage.

Each turn, players traverse the board performing sailing actions, which add loot to the game's treasure chest. When they reckon there's sufficient booty, one of the players calls for a parley to divide the loot. Players take turns secretly reaching into the chest to take a hidden share of loot. Once all the treasure is divided, pirates vote on whether to keep their hidden shares, or return the loot to the chest.

To gain the support of the crew, it's important to be fair. Just...not too fair. Will you take what you deserve? Or maybe a little extra? Can you trust the pirates who reached in before you?

DemocraSea is a great way to try your hand at politics, just be sure you know a reliable hook merchant.

197839.name: Hide & Hold Out - H2o
197839.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Hide & Hold Out is a multiplayer survival game taking place in a devastated water world. Gather, build, team up with your friends and establish the foundations of your future floating empire utilizing the heavy guns of your battle ships!

Source: The Game Website.

197840.name: Kill to Collect
197840.description:
Welcome to the last city on Earth. Earn your keep and die trying in Pieces Interactive’s cyberpunk action rogue-like, featuring 1-4 player co-op. Travel down the sleepless cesspool of murderous vagrants and cybernetic freaks, as you slice and dice your way to the lower levels of Geoshelter Alpha.

Source: The Game Website.

197841.name: Super Robo Mouse
197841.description:
User Summary

Robo the mouse has to collect Titanium Cheese to unlock the gates and escape the maze.

197842.name: Caribbean Secrets
197842.description:
User summary:

This game was developed as a series of forum posts, each one providing further elaboration or clarification. Characters in the game are investigators sent to learn about a voodoo cult; in the process, they may well fall sway to the religious pull of the cult's practices. The game uses a pack of French playing cards to introduce random events and also to resolve opposed actions.

By far the most intriguing part of the game, however, is the requirement that players wear marked T-shirts that function as their character sheets. Throughout the game, markers are used to place additional items onto the T-shirt-cum-character-sheet.

197843.name: MXGP2: The Official Motocross Videogame
197843.description:
MXGP2 - The Official Motocross Videogame is the evolution of the previous Milestone’s Motocross game MXGP. The game is based on the 2015 FIM Motocross World Championship license.

Source: The Game Website.

197844.name: Diorama No.3: The Marchland
videogamehonor: 2016 A MAZE. Awards Best Use of Technology Winner
197844.description:
Visit The Marchland, a place where a drop of rain makes the difference between presence and absence of the passerby. Are these ghosts, or could the spectator be one? The Marchland is the 3rd virtual reality diorama in 'The Shoebox Diorama' series.

Source: The Game Website.

197846.name: The Napoleonic Wargame
197846.description:
A book containing rules for miniature wargames covering the Napoleonic Wars using various figure scales frokm 5mm to 30 mm and various ground scales of 1mm:2yds to 1in:10yds.

From the back of the book:

A criticism levelled at many books on wargaming is that they attempt to cover too wide a period of military history. This book concentrates on one of the most active and interesting episodes in the history of warfare - the Napoleonic Wars. The author firmly believes that wargames should duplicate the conditions and events of real warfare as far as is possible within the context of a set of rules. Among the factors which he stresses are the use of realistic scales and the importance of morale. He also believes that, provided the player has done his research, the rules should be flexible enough to allow him to employ unconventional tactics. After all, neither Napoleon nor Wellington won their battles by sticking to previously accepted ideas on tactics.
This book is the result of a long experience of wargaming and painstaking historical research. Whether the reader accept the author's conclusions or not he will certainly find much both to enjoy and discuss. The text is illustrated with eight pages of colour photographs and nearly 40 line drawings.

197847.description:
A cheeky little card game of face-stuffing hamsters and double entendre for all the family (2-8 players).

CheekZ is a highly strategic hamster-powered version of Poker. Players take turns placing Battle, Attack and Defence cards until all Cheekz are empty. The winner then gets to spread the Cheekz of the other players and choose one to discard a Cheek. Players then Stash their Seed - but look out for Toxic and Exploding Seeds as players reveal a Dirty Cheek!
197847.name: CheekZ

197848.name: Tu Mi Turbi
197848.description:
User summary:

The game uses a series of valued tokens to represent relative influence of the characters during play. Tokens are wagered - spent - to gain narrative ascendancy. Each of the three defined characters (Alfa, Beta, and Gamma) have identified roles and slightly different abilities. The game document provides two possible scenarios - one is for a relaxed game, the other for a more serious and tense game.

This game was submitted to the Italian-language Game Chef 2013 competition.

197849.name: Codex Infernus: The Savage Guide to Hell
197849.description:
A holy warrior fighting back infernal beasts on the precipice of a fiery pit. Cloaked figures chanting an incantation to bring forth a nameless beast. A man standing at a crossroads bartering with a demonic temptress for fame and fortune; the price of which is his very soul.

Advisers to kings and queens, dictators and presidents, whispering lies at the behest of their demon lords with the fate of nations resting on whether or not the advice is heeded. A scientist examining a strange artifact found on a distant planet that, unbeknownst to him, opens a mysterious gate to a nightmarish dimension when a button is pushed.

These are just a sampling of the myriad images which come to mind when we think of Hell. Codex Infernus: The Savage Guide to Hell, brings those images to life and shows you how to plug them into your games, regardless of what genre you love to play!

In this book you'll find:

- Ready-to-play character archetypes for fantasy and modern games.
- New Fantasy races
- A new Demonic race: Cambion
- New Edges and Arcane Backgrounds
- Guidelines for creating Angelic, Demonic, and Hell-forged weapons
- Guidelines for blessing items—even if you don’t have an Arcane Background!
- An immersive Fantasy campaign setting
- A detailed section on Hell itself
- Guidelines for creating cults
- A brief look at Hell in various cultures stemming back to ancient Mesopotamia!
- Rules for demonic pacts, demonic possession, and an optional corruption system
- Hellish hazards!
