In the stage 3, the players must use the same tiles but with the numbers/symbol faced up and using the same scrabble-like rules to form equations. And again, the more tiles used and equations formed, the better score you will get.

The winner is the player with most point after adding score of both stages 2 and 3.

The game can also start with the numbers/symbols faced up on the stage 1. In this case, the "stage 3" will be the second one and the "stage 2" will be the last one.

197978.name: Adventurers of Kara-Tur
197978.description:
From the introduction:

Expand your options for PC creation using the subclasses, race, and additional weapons and equipment from the lands of Kara-Tur!

User summary:


Fighter Archetypes (Bushi, Samurai, Sohei)
Monastic Tradition (Kensai)
Roguish Archetypes (Ninja, Yakuza)
Sorcerous Origin (Wu Jen)
Playable Race (Yokai)
Equipment (Armor, Weapons)

197979.name: Discordant Drifter
197979.description:
From the document:

This new background was specifically created to accommodate..."pop-in players". These are players that might only have time to come to a single game session or perhaps are just irregular players due to schedule conflicts. I designed this [background] so that there is some reasonable rationale as to why a PC might pop in and out of a larger campaign overall. It can be used in any setting and allows for flexibility to be used with any class as well as gives the opportunity for the DM to weave their own creativity into the main story line they happen to be running.

User summary:

An unusual character background.

197980.name: The Fasting Worm at the Spider Feast
197980.description:
Who will be served for dinner in this demonic grudge match adventure?

From the introduction:

Eons ago, the demon lord Shomarrah defamed Lolth the Spider Queen, condemning herself into the cursed life of a massive purple worm. Now Shomarrah’s desecrated body serves as a drow fortress, guarded by a mad sorcerer and his team of driders. What deeper evils lie within?

User summary:

A one-shot adventure for a party of 3 - 5 characters of about level 8.

197981.name: Gregorio's Traveling Emporium and Menagerie
197981.description:
From the introduction:

This encounter can be inserted at any point the characters are traveling along an established road. They come across Gregorio in the morning as he is preparing to leave his camp, or in the evening as he is setting up.

User summary:

For 2nd level characters.

197982.name: The Black Hand: A Guide to the Tal'Mahe'Ra (V20)
197982.description:
From publisher blurb:

We Deal in the Truth.

Every interaction, every fight, every clandestine meeting, it’s all about the truth. The truth hurts. The truth kills. But in the end, the truth protects. The truth shapes the world. Shape the world with us.

The Tal’Mahe’Ra, the Black Hand, plays the long game. They’re fighting a war of millennia, and the stakes could never be higher than they are tonight. They know truths about the Ancients, terrifying truths, dangerous truths, and they know the fight will be long and tireless.

The Black Hand — A Guide to the Tal’Mahe’Ra includes:

An updated look at the Tal’Mahe’Ra, which brings the ancient conspiracy into the twenty-first century.
Tricks of the Black Hand’s trade, including new Disciplines, Backgrounds, Merits, and eldritch sorceries.
Insight into some of the Hand’s sects, including those who hunt the infernal, and the worshipers of Lilith.

197984.name: Mr. M's Equipment Emporium
197984.description:
From publisher blurb:

Looking for an exotic item with an interesting back story? Have you found something unusual that you need to know the value of or just want to sell? Or are you just wondering what that big neon sign is all about?

Welcome to Mr. M's Equipment Emporium. Mr. M's Equipment Emporium is a shop that deals with the exotic and is well known for its unique items, reasonable prices, and its owner's amazing stories. Mr. M deals in the varied and unusual from alien artifacts to strange works of art to storied weapons and everything in between. You never know what you'll find on the shelves inside but you can always be assured there is a great story behind it.

197985.name: Blue Pearl Grotto
197985.description:
From publisher blurb:

Iridescent blue pearls highly desired for their unique color and rumored to have magical properties have become much more common over the past few years. Rumors trace their source to a merchant in a seacoast village. Other rumors tell of a wild witch that lives in a cave by the sea and conjures the pearls from the cliffs themselves.

The Blue Pearl Grotto is the source of these naturally-occurring, rare, blue pearls. Katelyn Blauvulf is a reclusive merchant that sells the pearls. She is also a sorceress that cultivates the oysters in the grotto. Friendly, but fiercely protective of the source of the pearls, the secrets of the grotto belong only to her, at least for now.

197986.name: Gloria's
197986.description:
From publisher blurb:

A relatively new restaurant, Gloria’s is currently THE place for the social elite and leaders of business and government to see and be seen. Organized around this idea, the restaurant provides high visibility and plenty of opportunities to mingle and rub shoulders with other patrons. The cuisine is excellent and features fare from every possible culture and species. Of course all that service comes with a hefty price tag.

Gloria herself is a young vivacious woman with a gift for languages and, judging by the success of her restaurant, a good head for business. She is most often found wandering the floor of the restaurant interacting with her guests and making connections among those with similar interests.

197987.name: Shrine of the Harvest Goddess
197987.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in the heart of the forest lies a small clearing at the center of which stands an immaculate statue of the harvest goddess. Tended by a dedicated priest, this shrine has been standing for over a century. A power emanates from the statue as if the goddess herself stands there.

Omri Hallam was the priest of the harvest goddess when his city was destroyed by war. He has faithfully tended the shrine as the forest has reclaimed the land once occupied by the city. Old beyond a normal lifespan, he has been blessed by the goddess to continue his work. Friendly to the rare visitor, he seems to have great knowledge of the outside world.

197988.name: Cheat Code
197988.description:
From publisher blurb:

Granted a wish for saving a young woman from attackers, Reggie asked for the ability to use cheat codes IRL. Now, as Cheat Code, he uses his smarts, skills, creativity, and “computer game” powers to pwn any noob he wants! Or, really, anyone he wants.

197989.name: TRUMPshit crazy
197989.description:
TRUMPsh*t crazy, is a card game in the vein of Cards Against Humanity. Or in this case Cards Against Politics, Civility, Decency, Political Correctness, Feminism, Human Rights, Civil Rights, Peace and whatever else he spouts forth, generally the complete opposite of what is socially acceptable.

We have taken a wide, varied and often horrifying selection of quotes from the great pumpkin candidate and you get to use them to postulate views in his dulcet and sometimes vitriolic verbal tone.

Players draw 8 red "quote" cards and a player draws and reads out a blue "ask" card. The other players pick their funniest or inappropriate or topical card and hand it to the reader whoc picks the winner. The person with the most blue "ask" cards wins. Play to a timer or till all the cards are gone.

120 "ask" cards and 240 "quote" cards.

197990.name: Underground Sea
197990.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 298th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features the rocky shores of an underground sea.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

197991.name: Seabird and Stella
197991.description:
User summary:

This rules-light story-telling game uses three play zones that contain word cards. Each zone may contain only a certain number of cards. The cards must be made but can be very simple. A die roll determines which zone or zones are open to that player for their turn. From these random elements the narrative structure is then provided during play. The Seabird character is in fact a seabird. Stella and the Three Men are humans.

197992.name: Dead Running
197992.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have an assigned Guild, which is like a lightweight Class. They also have four Traits (Attributes), including Intelligence, Strength, Charisma, and Insight. Each of these Traits have an assigned die type, usually starting with a d6. During character creation, players can spend points to increase a Trait's die type (e.g., d6 to d8, etc.). Characters also receive a Loyalty Card at random, informing them whether they are a traitor. The Loyalty Card is provided as a print-and-play component. The document also includes print-and-play character sheets.

197993.name: Chakram
197993.description:
From publisher blurb:

A talented stuntwoman tried to stand in the way of a villain and was casually tossed aside, ending her career. However, the experience triggered latent powers--powers she now uses as a villain-for-hire. Unlike villains motivated by greed or insanity, Chakram is a pro and has earned the respect of the people she works for.

197994.name: Kata Kumbas: Avventure per Laitia
197994.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bentornati viandanti, sulle magiche strade di Laìtia, dove l’aria profuma di rosmarino e maggiorana!

In questo volume troverete otto avventure, a spasso per varie contrade dell’Italia fantastica, scritte da alcuni degli autori più famosi del panorama ludico nazionale!

Riuscirete a scoprire cosa si nasconde dietro il Mistero di Borgoratto, di Davide Mana? Vi unirete al Gatto Lupesco di Mauro Longo in un viaggio ricco di colpi di scena e pericoli, alla ricerca di un antico sovrano? Svelerete il mistero che si cela dietro la Febbre Brumia di Andrea Sfiligoi? Combatterete un antico male al sapore di tortellino con Tito Leati? Seguirete un maiale molto speciale tra le nebbie della Zolia di Eugenio Lauro oppure preferirete volare sulle ali dell’avinuberio di Massimo Moscarelli? Oppure passerete una notte sul Monte Rosso con Luca Tarenzi o cercherete di sciogliere la strana maledizione del Piripicchio, di Umberto Pignatelli?

Questo e molto altro vi attende nel secondo mirabolante volume di Kata Kumbas!


Translation courtesy of Google:

Welcome back travelers, the magical streets of Laìtia, where the air smells of rosemary and marjoram!

In this book you will find eight adventures, walking for several fantastic Italian districts, written by some of the most famous authors of the national recreational scene!

197998.name: Laser Metal
197998.description:
User summary:

Character creation involves selecting a Class (The Core, Doom Wailer, Fat Bottom, Gun Witch, Order of Metal Monk, or Shred Master), distributing a points pool into Stats (Attributes), including Agility, Intelligence, Might, and Metal. Characters select a number of Skills and distribute points into them. Characters also have and gain Abilities as they gain levels. A variety of derived attributes are also calculated. Opposed action resolution involves a modified 2d6 roll compared against a target.

The fairly typical game system is coupled with a humorous and "over the top" quasi-science fiction setting with numerous major elements derived from the heavy metal music scene.
